properties.anno.base.angle:D: The rotation angle of the object (-359.99..359.99)
properties.anno.base.loc.x:D: The X coordinate of the object (0.0..1.0)
properties.anno.base.loc.y:D: The Y coordinate of the object (0.0..1.0)
properties.anno.base.scale.x:D: The horizontal scale factor for this object
properties.anno.base.scale.y:D: The vertical scale factor for this object
properties.anno.base.tag:D: User-defined tag for this object. If configured under Edit > Preferences > Metadata, IMatch converts the tag into a keyword automatically.
properties.anno.faces.tags:D: If the image contains face annotations, this property shows the associated tags.
properties.anno.layer.name: Layer Name
properties.anno.shape.framecolor:D: Color for the frame or outline
properties.anno.shape.framewidth:D: Width of the frame or outline
properties.anno.sticker.name: Name
properties.anno.textbox.font:D: The font face to use to render the text
properties.anno.textbox.framecolor:D: Color for the frame or outline
properties.anno.textbox.framewidth:D: Width of the frame or outline
properties.anno.textbox.halign:D: The horizontal alignment of the text within the surrounding box
properties.anno.textbox.innermargin:D: These margins control the distance between the text and the surrounding box
properties.anno.textbox.scalewt:D: If enabled, the font size is scaled with the object.
properties.anno.textbox.text:D: The text for the text box. You can just type in text or combine it with IMatch variables. This gives you full access to all the metadata in your database.
properties.anno.textbox.valign:D: The vertical alignment of the text within the surrounding box
properties.app.autoloaddb:D: If this setting is enabled, the last used database is loaded automatically on the next program start
properties.app.autostackcopies:D: If you copy a file which is part of a stack, do you want the copy to become part of the same stack?
properties.app.autoversioncopies:D: If you copy a file which is part of a version set, do you want the copy to be versioned automatically through a manual link?
properties.app.backup.prompt.cd.100: Once a month, when IMatch closes
properties.app.backup.prompt.cd.20: Once a day, when IMatch closes
properties.app.backup.prompt.cd.50: Once a week, when IMatch closes
properties.app.backup.prompt.cd.60: Every two weeks, when IMatch closes
properties.app.backup.prompt:D: Enable one of the options to make IMatch remind you to backup your database and other data when you close IMatch.
properties.app.checkforupdate:D: If this is enabled, IMatch checks for updates once a week and notifies you when a newer version is available.
properties.app.developermode:D: If this is enabled, additional features become available for App Developers.
properties.app.diagnosisprompt:D: This setting controls how often IMatch asks you to run a database diagnosis. The database diagnosis checks your database for potential problems, compresses the database and updates performance-related statistics. You should run the Diagnosis frequently.
properties.app.dpiaware:D: If this setting is on (default), IMatch disables automatic DPI-scaling. This means that Windows does not automatically 'scale' the IMatch user interface to match your screen's resolution, which often produces blurry icons and fonts. Instead you use the options provided by IMatch to use larger icons and fonts as you see fit.
properties.app.et.verboselogging:D: Enable this setting to log verbose information to the ExifTool output panel. This may be helpful if you run into problems while writing metadata to files.
properties.app.favorites.compactlayout:D: If this is enabled (default), the Favorites Panel favors a compact layout with as many columns per row as possible.
properties.app.geo.autorg:D: Enable this option to automatically performs reverse geocode on files when you set or modify their GPS coordinates in the Map Panel. Reverse geocoding means retrieving address data like country and city based on the GPS corodinates.
properties.app.geo.basepage:D: This URL is used as the base page for the Geo panel. You can enter an URL (http://) or the address of a local file on disk (file://). The base page must use the special IMatch Geo script library.
properties.app.geo.bingmaps.apikey:D: To access Bing Maps, you need a Bing Maps API key which you can request from Microsoft.
properties.app.geo.bingmaps.enabled:D: Enable this option to make Bing Maps available in the Maps Panel. PLEASE NOTE that by using Bing Maps you are bound by the Bing Maps Terms of Service which you can review on the Microsoft website.
properties.app.geo.browser.scale:D: This setting controls the scale factor used for the embedded web browser. By default, IMatch uses a 100% scale factor. You can increase this scale factor if you use IMatch on a high-resolution screen to make the data on maps easier to read (may depend on the used map service).
properties.app.geo.coding.service:D: Choose the service to use for reverse-geocoding (getting an address from GPS coordinates). By using a service you certify that you are bound by their terms of service and usage restrictions. Check their websites for additional info.
properties.app.geo.formatting.city:D: The EXIF and XMP location metadata has no field for a postal code or ZIP code. Geocoding services however deliver this data. IMatch can produce a city name by combining the city name with the postal code into the 'City' metadata tag.\r\nUse the placeholder {city} for the city name and {pc} for the postal code / ZIP code to tell IMatch how to format city names. If none of these placeholders is given, only the city name is used.
properties.app.geo.formatting.location:D: This mask allows you to customize the format of the location field. The placeholder {location} is replaced by the location data delivered by the Geocoding service. Mix it freely with literal text as needed.\nLeave the mask empty if you don't need any custom formatting.
properties.app.geo.formatting.state:D: This mask allows you to customize the format of the state field. The placeholder {state} is replaced by the state data delivered by the Geocoding service. Mix it freely with literal text as needed.\nLeave the mask empty if you don't need any custom formatting.
properties.app.geo.geonames.apikey:D: To use GeoNames-based features you need to enter your personal or corporate GeoNames username here.
properties.app.geo.googlemaps.apikey:D: If required, enter your personal or corporate Google Maps API key here. This key must be activated for JavaScript Maps API, Geocoding API and Elevation API.
properties.app.geo.googlemaps.enabled:D: Enable this option to make Google Maps available in the Maps Panel. PLEASE NOTE that by using Google Maps you are bound by the Google Maps/Google Earth APIs Terms of Service which you can review on the Google website.
properties.app.geo.lang:D: The language (two-letter code like 'en', 'de', ...) to use for the map and geocoding services. Note that not all services support all languages. If you leave this empty, the user interface language set for IMatch is used.
properties.app.geo.locations.show:D: If enabled, IMatch displays all Locations on the map.
properties.app.geo.maxfiles:D: If too many files are selected, the Geo Panel may require a long time or even run into a timeout while trying to render all locations. This threshold controls how many files the Geo Panel attempts to render without asking for your permission.
properties.app.geo.panzoombar: Use large pan and zoom control
properties.app.geo.panzoombar:D: Use a large zoom and pan control element. If this is off, IMatch displays only a small +/- zoom control on the map.
properties.app.geo.search.service:D: To find places on the map (geocoding) IMatch uses the search service selected here. Please note that by using these services you are bound by their terms of service and usage restrictions. Check their websites for additional info.
properties.app.geo.var:D: This allows you to automatically create keywords after GPS data has been set interactively or automatically. Use a free mix of text and IMatch variables (like {File.MD.country} or {File.MD.location}). To create a hierarchical keyword, separate the levels with |. Example: WHERE|{File.MD.country|default:NO COUNTRY}|{File.MD.city|default:NO CITY}|{File.MD.location|default:NO LOCATION} => WHERE|United Kingdom|London|Tower Bridge. You can specify multiple expressions by separating them with ;
properties.app.help.apppath:D: The folder containing the help app. Leave empty to use the default.
properties.app.help.webhelp:D: If this is enabled, IMatch uses the online version of the IMatch Help System available at the photools.com website. This guarantees the most up-to-date version of the help. If this is disabled, IMatch uses the locally installed version of the IMatch help (separate download).
properties.app.imws.shfwebroot:D: The folder containing apps and scripts for IMatch.
properties.app.movecopystacks:D: If this setting is enabled and you copy/move the top of a collapsed stack, all files in the stack are also copied/moved.
properties.app.preventsleep:D: Activate this option to prevent Windows from going to sleep when IMatch is busy ingesting files or writing metadata.
properties.app.preview.showanno:D: If this is on, IMatch shows annotations in the Quick View panel
properties.app.preview.showmci:D: Enable this option to use the MCI video player built-into Windows. It supports a video range of video formats, but may be unstable on older Window versions or when you don't have up-to-date video codecs installed. It may even crash IMatch.
properties.app.preview.showmhtml:D: Enable this option to use display HTML files in the built-in browser. If you consider this a privacy risk, disable this option.
properties.app.processcontrol.corethreads:D: The number of parallel threads for importing files into the database. Leave the value to 0 to automatically choose the best number of threads based on the number of available processors.
properties.app.processcontrol.metareadthreads:D: The number of parallel threads for importing metadata into the database. Leave the value to 0 to automatically choose the best number of threads based on the number of available processors.
properties.app.processcontrol.metawritethreads:D: The number of parallel threads for writing metadata. Leave the value to 0 to automatically choose the best number of threads based on the number of available processors.
properties.app.protection.pw:D: If you enter a password for this property, you have to enter the password in order to enable the display of protected files. Don't lose this password!
properties.app.protection.style:D: This setting controls how protected files are displayed.
properties.app.readonlydb:D: If this setting is enabled, IMatch opens  local and remote databases in read-only mode. This is required if you want to share databases with other users. Only when all users open a database in read-only mode it can be shared.
properties.app.settingsstorefilename:D: The name and path of the file containing the IMatch settings database. Leave this empty for the default location. If you want to keep the settings database on a central server or NAS system, copy the settings file to that system and enter the folder name here. Restart IMatch to switch to the new location. For details, see help file.
properties.app.shfpresets:D: The folder containing presets for various features in IMatch. Changing this setting requires a restart of IMatch.
properties.app.showpopups:D: If enabled, IMatch displays small popup windows in the Windows taskbar, e.g. to inform you about completed operations. These popups are only displayed when IMatch is not the active application.
properties.app.skin:D: Choose one of the available user interface styles.
properties.app.spelling.auto:D: If this is enabled, IMatch automatically performs spell-checking when you type.
properties.app.spelling.dicfolder:D: The folder containing the Hunspell dictionaries on your system. See Help for details.
properties.app.spelling.diclang:D: The language to use for spell-checking.
properties.app.spelling.userdicfilename:D: The file name of your user-defined dictionary. IMatch stores words you add to your dictionary in this file.
properties.app.telemetry.enabled:D: If this setting is enabled, IMatch records anonymous (not linked to your person or license) telemetry data and sends it to photools.com. This data helps photools.com to make IMatch better. We can learn about how users work with IMatch, which features are used or not, which features cause problems or are slow to use and more. Only we will see this data and we don't share it.
properties.app.ui.autohidefast:D: This setting controls how fast auto-hide panels expand and contract. Set it to false to use a slower animation. Changes to this option are applied when you restart IMatch.
properties.app.ui.browserscale:D: This setting controls the scale factor used for App Panels, the App Manager and the Map Panel. Use this to adjust the size of text and images to your liking. The default value is 0, which means 100%. Use values smaller than 0 to reduce the scale and reduce the text size. Use values above 0 to increase the font size for better readability.
properties.app.ui.iconsize:D: This setting controls the size icons used in File Windows and other elements.
properties.app.ui.infopopup.background:D: The background color used for info popups
properties.app.ui.infopopup.fontsize:D: Font size used by the popup in points.
properties.app.ui.infopopup.showtime:D: Controls how long info popups are shown. Time is in seconds (10 seconds max.)
properties.app.ui.infopopup.textcolor:D: The text color used for info popups
properties.app.ui.menusize:D: This setting controls the size of the menues in the application.
properties.app.ui.rejects.dim:D: Enable this option to display thumbnails of rejected files in a dimmed fashion.
properties.app.ui.rejects.usedel:D: Enable this option to reject files with the Delete (Del) key. Press Delete (Del) again to remove the reject property.
properties.app.ui.resolution:D: This setting specifies the resolution in dots per inch (DPI) IMatch should use when displaying image dimensions in inches or centimeter.
properties.app.ui.showidplate:D: The ID plate is displayed at the very top of the application window. You can use it to "brand" your copy of IMatch
properties.app.ui.tabstyle:D: This setting controls how the tabs for panels are arranged when there is not enough space
properties.app.ui.tbsize:D: This setting controls the size of the toolbars.
properties.app.ui.thumbbackcolor:D: The background color used for thumbnails in various controls and windows
properties.app.ui.thumbnailapplyicc:D: Enable this enable color management for thumbnails. Depending on the performance of your computer this can slow down display and scroll speed in file windows.
properties.app.ui.thumbnailenlarge:D: If this is enabled, the file window can display thumbnails at scales larger than 100% of the thumbnail size available in the database. This can produce blurry results if you make the thumbnail panels really large.
properties.app.ui.thumbnailsettings:D: Set this to Yes to apply thumbnail settings like sharpen, vibrancy and ICC profile.
properties.app.ui.thumbnailsharpen:D: The amount of sharpen to apply to thumbnails. IMatch uses this value to dynamically sharpen thumbnails for display. The value you enter here is adjusted to the actual display size of the thumbnail in the file window. Set to 0 to disable.
properties.app.ui.thumbnailvibrance:D: This setting controls how much IMatch improves colors and contrast in thumbnails for display purposes. Set to 0 to disable.
properties.app.ui.thumbtips:D: If this is enabled (default), IMatch displays tooltips with thumbnails to preview the files in folders, categories, collections and other objects. You can also toggle this option via the View menu.
properties.app.ui.tooltip.background:D: The background color used for tooltips
properties.app.ui.tooltip.textcolor:D: The text color used for tooltips
properties.app.ui.treeiconsize:D: This setting controls the size icons used in the Folder & Media tree, the Category Tree, etc.
properties.app.ui.usegrayscaleicons:D: This setting controls if certain user interface elements are displayed in gray scale instead of color.
properties.app.ui.useimagedpi:D: If enabled, IMatch uses the DPI information available in the image (EXIF). If no DPI information is found, the assumed resolution is used instead.
properties.app.ui.usesmallicons:D: This setting controls if small icons are used for controls and other user interface elements (where applicable)
properties.app.useloaderoverlay:D: If this setting is enabled, IMatch displays a load progress overlay window when you add large amounts of files to your database. This disables the user interface and allows IMatch to process the files faster. You can close the overlay at any time to continue with your work while IMatch processes files in the background.
properties.app.user.alias:D: If this is empty (Default), IMatch uses the name of the logged in user (Windows user) to load and store settings. If you work with IMatch on multiple computers and you log in with different user names on these computers, you can specify a 'shared' user name to use for IMatch settings here. Note that this user name only affects IMatch settings, but not the per-user Windows resources like the Document and Settings folders. These are still accessed using the Windows user name.
properties.app.userecyclebin:D: If this setting is enabled, IMatch uses the Windows recycle bin for file delete and other file operations
properties.app.viewer.allowgrow:D: If the Viewer is in 'fit-to-window' mode and the image displayed is smaller than the screen, the image is enlarged to fit the available screen width/height, depending on the orientation and aspect ratio. Enable this to always use the full screen for smaller images.
properties.app.viewer.autoadvance:D: If enabled, the Viewer moves to the next file when you apply a rating, label or bookmark.
properties.app.viewer.colormanage:D: Enables or disables color management. You should only disable color management if your images are in RGB or you want maximum performance in the Viewer.
properties.app.viewer.delmoves:D: If enabled, the Viewer moves to the next file when the current file is deleted
properties.app.viewer.face.fontsize:D: The font size used to display face annotations in the Viewer and the Quick View Panel.
properties.app.viewer.face.source:D: This setting controls which image IMatch uses when searching for faces.
properties.app.viewer.fullload:D: If this is enabled, the viewer always loads the full-scale image in the background and also applies the color profile in advance. This makes loading files a bit slower and also uses more memory, but allows you to instantly dive-zoom into images. If you deactivate this option, the viewer loads images in 'fit-to-window' mode only in the required resolution. When you do a dive-zoom, the viewer has to load the full image first, which causes a delay.
properties.app.viewer.fwtip.transparency:D: Controls the visibility (1% to 100%) of the text overlay when the mouse pointer is not within the text overlay. Make the text overlay more or less visible with this setting.
properties.app.viewer.opencloses:D: If this option is enabled and you open a file from the Viewer in another application, the Viewer closes. This conserves memory and other resources.
properties.app.viewer.preloader.max: How many files to preload in background (0 = Auto)
properties.app.viewer.preloader.max:D: By default, this option is 0 and IMatch determines automatically, how many files to preload in the background for a smooth viewing experience.\r\n\r\nThis option can be helpful when your graphic card causes problems with the automatic preloading. If you experience problems, 'black frames' etc. try to reduce the number of preloaded files (e.g., to 2 or 3) until the problem goes away.
properties.app.viewer.preloader:D: If this option is on (Default), the Viewer and the Quick View Panel pre-load files in the background. This makes switching between files almost instant, but causes more stress for the graphic card. If you experience problems while working in the Viewer or Quick View Panel, or your computer uses a low-end graphic card, disable this option.
properties.app.viewer.ptcraw.prefer:D: By default, IMatch uses installed WIC Codecs provided by camera vendors, Microsoft or 3rd parties to extract previews and cache images from RAW images. The integrated photools.com RAW processor is used as a fallback if no WIC codec is installed or if it fails to load a RAW image. If you want to ignore installed WIC codecs and use photools.com RAW processing always, enable this option.
properties.app.viewer.selonclose:D: If this option is enabled, the Viewer selects the last viewed file in the current file window when it closes.
properties.app.viewer.shlevel100:D: Controls the amount of sharpness to use for images displayed in the Viewer and the Quick View panel at 100% zoom level. A Level of 0 disables sharpen. You can control how much the image is sharpened when displayed at 1:1 size independently from how the image is sharpened when displayed at a zoom level or in fit-to-window mode. This gives you very fine control over the process.
properties.app.viewer.shlevel:D: Controls the amount of sharpness to use for images displayed in the Viewer and the Quick View panel. A Level of 0 disables sharpen.
properties.app.viewer.singlesel.openstack: Single selection loads stack or version stack
properties.app.viewer.singlesel.openstack:D: If only one file is selected, and this file is the top of a collapsed stack or version stack, open the entire stack in the Viewer.
properties.app.viewer.singlesel:D: If this option is enabled and only one file is selected when you launch the Viewer, the Viewer loads all files in the current scope.
properties.app.viewer.skipdeleted:D: If this is enabled, the Viewer skips files with the delete mark when you navigate with the keyboard or the scroll wheel. Use <Alt>+Cursor to override or click on the deleted image in the film strip to select it.
properties.app.viewer.ssclose:D: If enabled and you open the Slide Show from the viewer, the viewer closes to conserve system resources.
properties.app.viewer.wrap:D: Enable this to automatically wrap-around when you reach either the last or first file.
properties.cachemanager.autopurge.mode:D: This setting controls if and how the preview cache is maintained. IMatch by default caches all suitable images and keeps them in the cache. This is the preferred setting for optimal performance. If you want to conserve disk space, you can instruct IMatch to automatically delete images from the cache if a certain cache size on disk is reached, or if images have not been viewed for a certain number of days. IMatch will re-create the cache images automatically if needed.
properties.cachemanager.autopurge.size:D: If you use the automatic cache purge, this setting controls the maximum cache size on disk (in GB). If the cache becomes larger than the size given here, images which have not been used for a long time are removed from the cache.
properties.cachemanager.dontcachejpg:D: If you work mostly with JPEG files and you usually keep your files on-line, you may enable this option. If this is enabled, IMatch will not produce cache images for JPEG files (*.jpg,*.jpeg,*.thm) and will instead always access the original file.
properties.cachemanager.folder:D: This folder holds the cache images for your database. Since the amount of space required can become rather large, use your largest and fastest hard disk for optimal performance.
properties.cachemanager.minsize:D: If you use embedded previews and the preview is smaller (in pixel) than this size, the full RAW file is loaded instead. Set this to 0 to use whatever preview size is in the file (not recommended).\nNote: For most RAW variants, a value of at least 1920 is recommended. You usually want either 100% previews or develop the full RAW data.
properties.cachemanager.mode:D: This setting controls how IMatch produces cache images for the files in your database. The Default mode produces cache images whenever images are added or updated. This is the best setting for almost all usage scenarios.\nThe on-demand setting produces cache images the first time IMatch accesses a file for display purposes. This saves disk space but you will notice a slight delay when IMatch needs to access the original file to produce the cache image.\nSet this to Off if you don't want IMatch to cache images at all. IMatch creates temporary cache images whenever one is needed and deletes them when you close IMatch.
properties.cachemanager.quality:D: The compression quality setting used for the cached images. A higher value produces larger files but gives better quality.
properties.cachemanager.size.h:D: The maximum height of the cache image in pixels. The minimum height is 300 pixel.
properties.cachemanager.size.perc:D: The size of the cached image as a percentage of the original. Unless you have very good reasons, always leave this at 100%.
properties.cachemanager.size.unit:D: This setting controls how the dimensions of cache files is specified. You can choose between a percentage of the original size or a specific pixel size. It is highlty recommended to produce cache files at 100% size. The maximum display size for features like the Viewer or the Slide show is limited by the dimensions of the available cache files.
properties.cachemanager.size.w:D: The maximum width of the cache image in pixels. The minimum width is 300 pixel.
properties.cachemanager.skipsize:D: Indexing very large files can be very time-consuming. You can save a lot of time if you specify a maximum file size here. Use 0 to indicate 'no limit'. For files larger than this size IMatch skips thumbnail, CRC checksum and cache file generation.
properties.cachemanager.useembedded:D: Enable this option to use the embedded preview images contained in most RAW formats. This is much faster than developing the RAW file.
properties.cef.clearcache:D: If this is enabled, IMatch clears the cache of the embedded browser when exiting. Use this option if there is a problem with the cache or the browser does not pick up changes done to files.
properties.cef.debugport:D: If this is 0, remote debugging of the embedded browser is disabled. Set this to a valid port number (e.g. 8080) to enable remote debugging.
properties.charts.colors:D: Select one of the available color schemes.
properties.charts.cutoff:D: If you want to limit the values in the chart to the Top-N best/largest values, enter a value greater than 0. If you use a cut-off you should also set the Sort Mode to Sums (Desc) to get the n elements with the highest occurance.
properties.charts.datasource:D: The data source used for the chart. You can either use a metadata tag or use one of the special analysis tools based on date and time, folder size etc.
properties.charts.headline.font:D: Choose a font for the headline. Leave empty to use the defautl font.
properties.charts.label.font:D: Choose a font for the labels. Leave empty to use the default font.
properties.charts.label.style:D: Choose a style for the labels.
properties.charts.legend.columns:D: How many columns to use for the legend? Use 0 for the default.
properties.charts.legend.font:D: Choose a font for the legend. Leave empty to use the default font.
properties.charts.legend.style:D: Choose a style for the legend.
properties.charts.legendpos:D: Choose a position for the legend.
properties.charts.norm:D: Enable this setting if you want to unify the spelling of the keywords.
properties.charts.numberformat:D: How to display the sums in the chart.
properties.charts.othername:D: The name to use for the 'Other' element.
properties.charts.showother:D: If this is enabled, the chart shows an 'Other' data element for all files without a value for the selected tag.
properties.charts.sortmode:D: How to sort the chart items.
properties.charts.style.cd.210: Horizontal bar with label on right
properties.charts.style:D: Select one of the available chart types.
properties.charts.substr:D: Enter the index of the first character (1 to n), a comma and the length in characters of the substring you want to use.\r\nExample: 1,10 to use the first 10 characters of each value.
properties.charts.tag:D: The metadata tag to analyze for this chart. This tag is used when the Data Source property is set to 'Metadata Tag'.
properties.charts.title: Title
properties.config.md.anno.mapregion: Import XMP face tags into Annotations
properties.config.md.anno.mapregion.format:D: How to write-back region data into XMP. The default is compliant with the specification of the Metadata Working Group, but IMatch can also write proprietary schemas used by some other applications.
properties.config.md.anno.mapregion:D: If this is enabled, IMatch imports XMP face regions into IMatch face Annotations.
properties.config.md.anno.mapregionlayer:D: The name of the annotation layer to use for importing face annotations.
properties.config.md.anno.mapregiontags:D: If this is enabled, IMatch maps the tags assigned to Face annotations to keywords.
properties.config.md.anno.mapregiontagsbase:D: IMatch combines this base path with the tags entered for the annotation to form hierarchical keywords. Leave empty if you want the tags to be converted to keywords on the topmost level. Enter a base path like 'people' or 'WHO|persons' to create hierarchical keywords from face tags. You can also enter multiple base paths, to import the keywords into multiple sections of your keyword hierarchy. Separate the individual base paths with a semicolon. Example: WHO|person;FAMILY
properties.config.md.crscrop.extlist: Apply Crop to these formats only
properties.config.md.crscrop.extlist:D: If you want to apply the XMP crop information only to selected formats, enter the extensions of these formats here, separated by a semicolon (Example: .nef;.nrw;.crw;.cr2). This may be required if you use software which stores crop data in already cropped images. If you change this setting after loading the images  into your database you need to reload the metadata. Press F1 for more information.
properties.config.md.crscrop:D: If enabled, IMatch imports and applies cropping information stored in XMP when displaying images. This option is valid for all future XMP imports.
properties.config.md.crwthmmode:D: This setting controls whether IMatch 'merges' the IPTC/EXIF data contained in the THM file with the proprietary metadata in the Canon CRW file when reading metadata. It also controls if IMatch writes changes also to the THM file when changes are written to the CRW file.
properties.config.md.datetimeimport.native:D: If this option is enabled, IMatch fills empty XMP created/digitized tags from the information gathered from native date and time information (e.g., for video, audio, PDF and Office formats)
properties.config.md.e2x:D: If this is enabled, IMatch imports existing EXIF data in the file into the corresponding fields in the XMP record.
properties.config.md.exif.tz:D: EXIF timestamps often contain no time zone information. When mapping EXIF into XMP timestamps, IMatch leaves the XMP time zone empty. If you want to use a non-empty time zone, enter it here in the format (+/-)HH:MM (for example: +02:00).
properties.config.md.fformats.allowcreate:D: IMatch updates existing classic IPTC/EXIF/GPS records in files but does not create new records for these old formats. Instead IMatch uses only the newer XMP metadata format. If you work with old applications which cannot handle XMP metadata you may need to enable this option.
properties.config.md.fformats.crop:D: If this is enabled and the XMP record for this file contains an enabled Crop record, it is applied to the image.
properties.config.md.fformats.exif:D: If this is on, IMatch writes EXIF data for this file format.
properties.config.md.fformats.iptc:D: If this is on, IMatch writes classic IPTC data (IIM) for this file format.
properties.config.md.fformats.pdf:D: If this is on, IMatch writes PDF data for this file format.
properties.config.md.fformats.sidecarmode:D: This option allows you to force IMatch to read and write XMP data from and to XMP sidecar files even when the file format uses embedded XMP metadata by default. Make sure you understand the consequences of this option before changing it. See the IMatch help for details.
properties.config.md.fformats.thm.merge:D: If a file with the .THM extension exists for a file in this format, IMatch merges metadata from the .THM file with metadata from the original file on read and write. Enable this option if you have .THM files containing IPTC and EXIF metadata.
properties.config.md.g2x:D: If this is enabled, IMatch imports existing GPS data in the file into the corresponding fields in the XMP record.
properties.config.md.i2x:D: If this is enabled, IMatch imports existing IPTC data in the file into the corresponding fields in the XMP record.
properties.config.md.ignorerating: Ignore rating of embedded XMP record
properties.config.md.ignorerating:D: Sometimes cameras write a partial XMP record into the RAW file, with a Rating=0 entry. This 'overrides' the XMP rating in the XMP sidecar file, which causes problems. If this setting is enabled (default), IMatch ignores the rating information from XMP records embedded in the original file if there is also an XMP file.
properties.config.md.iptc.tz:D: IPTC timestamps always require a time zone. When IMatch maps XMP timestamps into IPTC and the XMP timestamp has no time zone, IMatch applies the local time zone automatically. You can specify a different time zone in the format (+/-)HH:MM here (for example: +02:00). Leave the field empty to always use the local time zone if the XMP timestamp has no time zone.
properties.config.md.keepdatetime:D: If this option is enabled, IMatch keeps the 'last modified' date and time of files when metadata is written.
properties.config.md.keepxmp:D: While ingesting the metadata of a file, IMatch produces 'rich' XMP data by importing IPTC, EXIF and GPS data into the XMP record, applying the Metadata Working Group rules. By default, IMatch keeps the data of a possibly existing XMP record in the file, adding only data not already existing. If you want to replace data in an existing XMP record with the data created by IMatch, set this option to No.
properties.config.md.minusm:D: Enable (default) this setting to ignore minor errors and warnings while writing metadata. Usually this should be enabled because otherwise IMatch cannot write data to files with minor errors or warnings. Disabling this option in combination with verbose logging may help to identify problems when writing to files.
properties.config.md.mwgcompliance:D: Set this option to setup default values for optimal compliance with the rules and guidelines defined by the Metadata Working Group.
properties.config.md.p2x:D: If this is enabled, IMatch imports existing PDF data in the file into the corresponding fields in the XMP record.
properties.config.md.protectratinglabel:D: If you add or update files, IMatch will remove the rating and label if the imported file has no rating or label. Enable this option to prevent this.
properties.config.md.protectunwritten:D: If this is enabled, IMatch does not overwrite modified metadata when importing metadata from files.\r\nThis setting is important when you work with multiple applications and these applications all modify metadata. Importing a file after modifications in another application can erase changes you have made to metadata in IMatch when these changes have not yet been written to the file.
properties.config.md.protectxmp:D: If a file is rescanned and it already has XMP data in the database, IMatch does not re-import IPTC/EXIF/GPS data from the original image into the XMP record. This protects XMP data if the metadata in the image and in the XMP record are not synchronized (because the data was not written by IMatch or you do not allow IMatch to update the original image file).
properties.config.md.richxmp: Produce rich XMP data on import
properties.config.md.richxmp:D: If this is on, IMatch imports existing IPTC, EXIF and GPS data into the XMP record to produce 'rich' XMP data. This import is performed when a file is first ingested, and later when you force a reload of the metadata.
properties.config.md.skiplist:D: List of file extensions (beginning with a .), separated with a semicolon.\r\nThis list contains the file extension of file formats for which you want to force IMatch to use external XMP sidecar files instead of embedding XMP data into the file directly.\r\nExample: .nef;.crw;.cr2
properties.config.md.skipthm:D: Allows to to ignore THM files when indexing folders. Some camera models (older Canon or Minolta models) create THM files.
properties.config.md.x2e:D: If this is enabled, IMatch updates an existing EXIF data record in the file with data from the XMP record.
properties.config.md.x2g:D: If this is enabled, IMatch updates an existing GPS data record in the file with data from the XMP record.
properties.config.md.x2i:D: If this is enabled, IMatch updates an existing IPTC data record in the file with data from the XMP record.
properties.config.md.x2p:D: If this is enabled, IMatch updates an existing PDF data record in the file with data from the XMP record.
properties.config.md.xmp.allowcreate:D: This option has been deactivated. A non-XMP based workflow is not longer possible because IMatch maintaines important data and preventing it from embedding metadata and also from writing a sidecar file would result in data-loss during write-backs. If this option is enabled, IMatch can create XMP sidecar files when they do not already exist.\r\nDisable this if you don't want IMatch to create XMP files for files which do not support embedded XMP metadata.
properties.config.md.xmp.forunsupported: Write XMP files for unsupported formats
properties.config.md.xmp.forunsupported:D: If this option is enabled, IMatch writes XMP sidecar files for file formats which do not support embedded XMP metadata.
properties.config.md.xmpexportmode.cd.10: Mode 1: Write to all supported formats
properties.config.md.xmpexportmode.cd.1000: Always write to XMP sidecar files (Default)
properties.config.md.xmpexportmode.cd.110: Use existing XMP sidecar file, else use Mode 1
properties.config.md.xmpexportmode.cd.120: Use existing XMP sidecar file, else use Mode 2
properties.config.md.xmpexportmode.cd.20: Mode 2: Write to all supported formats except excluded
properties.config.md.xmpexportmode.default:D: If this setting is enabled, IMatch always embeds XMP data in standard formats: ({0}). This makes IMatch compatible with standard applications used in digital workflows.
properties.config.md.xmpexportmode:D: This setting controls how IMatch writes XMP metadata to files. DO NOT change this setting unless you know what you are doing. Press F1 for more information.
properties.config.md.xmpimportmode.cd.20: Merge sidecar file and embedded XMP data
properties.config.md.xmpimportmode.default:D: If this setting is enabled, IMatch expects embedded XMP data in standard formats: ({0}). This makes IMatch compatible with standard applications used in digital workflows.
properties.config.md.xmpimportmode:D: This setting controls how IMatch deals with external XMP sidecar files.
properties.dbview.fm.backcolor.check.recursive:D: The background color used for the 'recursive' check box.
properties.dbview.fm.backcolor:D: The color used for the background of the control.
properties.dbview.fm.friendlynamescolor:D: The text color used to display friendly folder names.
properties.dbview.fm.reversesortorder:D: Enable this to reverse the sort order of the folder tree.
properties.dbview.fm.showcounts:D: Enable this option to display the total number of files in the folder and its sub-folders.\nPlease note that this option requires a lot of resources and you should enable it only if really needed.
properties.dbview.fm.showfriendlynames:D: If this option is enabled, the Folders&Media tree displays friendly folder names instead of the physical folder names.
properties.dbview.fm.showsize:D: Enable this option to display the total size of all files in a folder, including sub-folders.\nPlease note that this option requires a lot of resources and you should enable it only if really needed.
properties.dbview.fm.showthumbnails:D: Activate this option to show folder thumbnails instead of standard folder icons.
properties.dbview.fm.sortmode:D: This property controls how the elements in the tree view are sorted.
properties.dbview.fm.textcolor.check.recursive:D: The text color used for the 'recursive' check box.
properties.dbview.fm.textcolor:D: The text color used for the control.
properties.dbview.fm.thumbnailfillcolor:D: The background color used to fill thumbnails, and for folders without thumbnails
properties.dbview.fm.thumbnailframecolor:D: The frame color used to fill thumbnails, and for folders without thumbnails
properties.dbview.fm.thumbnailgrayscale:D: Activate this option to display thumbnails in grayscale.
properties.dbview.fm.thumbnailsize:D: Controls the size of folder thumbnails.
properties.dbview.fm.toplevelfullpath: Show full path for the first level
properties.dbview.fm.toplevelfullpath:D: If this option is enabled, IMatch displays the full path for all top-level folders. If you add multiple folders with the same name from different sections of your folder hierarchy as top-level folders to your database, this option allows you to differentiate them easier. Instead of two folders named "images" you will see "2012\images" and "2013\images", for example.

properties.filewnd.LOD.name: Name
properties.filewnd.LOD.name:D: The name of this item. It will be displayed in the column header.
properties.filewnd.LOD.postfix:D: Enter text or HTML code to display after the actual item. The postfix can be used to emit a short descriptive text, or unit or similar information.
properties.filewnd.LOD.prefix:D: Enter text or HTML-kode to display before the actual item. The prefix can be used to emit a short descriptive text or a label.
properties.filewnd.LOD.ratingbartype:D: Controls if and how the rating and label bar is displayed.
properties.filewnd.LOD.rowheight:D: The minimum row height in pixel. IMatch may adjust this setting to ensure that all visual elements are visible.
properties.filewnd.LOD.showcategorybar:D: If this is on, the category color bar is displayed in panels. It shows the colors of categories to which the item is assigned.
properties.filewnd.LOD.showicons:D: Enable this option to display information icons, flags and other elements inside the thumbnail panel
properties.filewnd.LOD.showthumbnail:D: Controls thumbnail display in the first column.
properties.filewnd.LOD.size:D: The height/width reserved for this item in pixels. If you set this to 0 or an empty value, IMatch will use a standard size based on the default font for this item
properties.filewnd.LOD.sortprofile:D: The sort profile to use for this layout. If this is empty, the sort profile selected in the file window toolbar will be used.
properties.filewnd.LOD.stretchthumbnail:D: If this is on, the thumbnail fills the entire thumbnail panel. Icons and other visual elements are shown above the thumbnail.
properties.filewnd.LOD.tag:D: The metadata tag to use as the source for this attribute.
properties.filewnd.LOD.thumbpanelcols:D: Defines the number of thumbnails visible per row. Depending on the attributes shown in the thumbnail panel and the available window with, more or less thumbnails can be displayed per row.

properties.filewnd.epshowcategorybar:D: If this is on, the category color bar is displayed in panels. It shows the colors of categories to which the item is assigned.

properties.filewnd.layout.panelwidth:D: Specifies the minimum width of the panel in pixels. The application may exceed this width to fit in the thumbnail and icons. Use a larger value to make more room for your custom metadata
properties.filewnd.panel.3dhi.focused:D: The highlight color for focused panels

properties.filewnd.panel.3dsh.focused:D: The shadow color for focused panels
properties.filewnd.panel.3dsh.normal:D: The shadow color for normal panels

properties.filewnd.panel.3dsh.selectedfocused:D: The shadow color for selected/focused panels
properties.filewnd.panel.fill:D: This option allows to control whether and how the thumbnail panel (the area surrounding the thumbnail) is filled.

properties.filewnd.panels.history.sortorder:D: This property controls if the newest or oldest entries are displayed at the top of the list.
properties.filewnd.panels.history.timerange:D: This property controls the time range displayed

properties.filewnd.showratingandlabelbar:D: If this is on, the rating and label color is displayed in panels.
properties.filewnd.simpleeditor.onheaderfooterclick: Clicking into header/footer opens layout editor
By default the simple layout editor opens when you left-´click into the header or footer area of a panel.
properties.filewnd.ui.anim.enabled:D: If this is enabled, the file window displays multiple frames for each video file when you move the mouse into a thumbnail panel.
properties.filewnd.ui.anim.steptime:D: The time between individual animation frames in millseconds (1000ms = 1 second).
properties.filewnd.ui.autoadvance:D: If this option is enabled, the file window moves the focus to the next file when you apply a rating, label or bookmark or when you reject a file.
properties.filewnd.ui.kb.ldblclk.ctrl:D: What to do when a file is <Ctrl>+double-clicked in the file window
properties.filewnd.ui.kb.ldblclk.shift:D: What to do when a file is <Shift>+double-clicked in the file window
properties.filewnd.ui.kb.ldblclk.shiftctrl:D: What to do when a file is <Shift>+<Ctrl>+double-clicked in the file window
properties.filewnd.ui.kb.ldblclk:D: What to do when a file is double-clicked in the file window
properties.filewnd.ui.resultwindow.filter.autopause: If this option is enabled, the Filter Panel is automatically paused when a Result Window becomes active.
properties.filewnd.viewtype:D: The view type to use for this file window
properties.groupdata.level.autog:D: Enable this if you want to insert an extra level based on the first n characters of each value. This is especially helpful when you create levels with hundreds or even thousands of elements.
properties.groupdata.level.autogsl:D: Enter the index of the first character (1..) and the number of characters (1..) you want to use for your auto-group.\r\nGood values are 1,1 or 1,2 for most cases.
properties.groupdata.level.dt:D: This setting allows you to override the automatic data type detection.\r\nIn <Bold>Automatic</Bold> mode, IMatch uses the data type information from the metabase. The other modes allow you to override this information and to treat the values as if of a special type. This can be useful if there is no data type information available or if you want to achieve a specific grouping.
properties.groupdata.level.exts:D: If you want to restrict this level to consider only files in specific formats, enter a list of file extensions to include, separated by ; Example: .jpg;.tif
properties.groupdata.level.filter:D: Enter a list of regular expressions, separated with a semicolon. IMatch will only include values matching at least one of these expressions in the level.\r\nExamples: "^A.*" (only elements starting with A). "beach" (only elements containing beach somewhere).
properties.groupdata.level.filtercs:D: By default, filter is not case-sensitive. Enable this option to make replace case-sensitive.
properties.groupdata.level.filterinv:D: Invert the result of the filter, using only values not matching the filter.
properties.groupdata.level.groupsflt:D: You can enter one or more category regular expressions, separated by ; The data-driven category then considers only files contained in one of these categories. See @Category in the help for more information.
properties.groupdata.level.hier:D: Activate this option if the values on this level contain hierarchy information you want to use, e.g. using IMatch 3 "dot-notation" or XMP hierarchical categories.\r\nIMatch can use this information and re-create them in the level.\r\nExamples for values with hierarchy info are "Photos.Family.Parents" or "Location\Beach\Daytona Beach"
properties.groupdata.level.hierseps:D: Enter a list of hierarchy separators, separated by a semicolon. If ; is a separator by itself, enter ~; instead.
properties.groupdata.level.lang:D: If you want to extract only values for a specific language, choose it here.
properties.groupdata.level.manual:D: If this option is on, the category is automatically updated in the background whenever needed. Set this to Off when the category takes very long to re-calculate (e.g. when you use variables) and it slows down other features in IMatch.
properties.groupdata.level.mode:D: Controls whether a metadata tag or a variable is used to calculate the elements on this level.\NOTE: Variables are very flexible and powerful, but also much slower to calculate than metadata tags. If possible, base your data-driven categories on tags.
properties.groupdata.level.norm:D: Enable this setting if you want to unify the spelling of the values.
properties.groupdata.level.normseps:D: Enter the characters which separate 'words' in the values. Tip: Use {tab} for tabulator, {cr} for carriage return, {lf} for linefeed.
properties.groupdata.level.other:D: Enable this option if you want to use the 'Other' element. This element contains all files without a value for the metadata tag on this level.
properties.groupdata.level.othername:D: Enter the name to use for the 'Other' element. If the name is not unique on a level, IMatch will make it unique by appending a number.
properties.groupdata.level.ranges:D: If the value is numeric (or you force it with the option above), you can use this option to filter out unwanted elements. Enter numeric ranges in the format lower,upper. If you want more than one range, separate the ranges with a semicolon.\r\nExample: 1,10 (all elements between 1 and 10). -20,-10 (all elements between -20 and -10).
properties.groupdata.level.rangesinvert:D: If this is enabled, the result of the numeric ranges is inverted. The level consists of elements *not* matching any of the ranges.
properties.groupdata.level.replace:D: Enter a list of "Pattern,Replace" regular expression pairs, separated with a semicolon. IMatch replaces all occurrences of Pattern with Replace.\r\nExample: Bech,Beach replaces all occurrences of "Bech" with "Beach".
properties.groupdata.level.replacecs:D: By default, replace is not case-sensitive. Enable this option to make replace case-sensitive.
properties.groupdata.level.ss:D: Enable this option to extract only a certain part of each value.
properties.groupdata.level.sssl:D: Enter the index of the first character (1 to n), a comma and the length in characters of the substring you want to use.\r\nExample: 1,10 to use the first 10 characters of each value.
properties.groupdata.level.tag:D: The metadata tag to use for grouping
properties.groupdata.level.tok:D: Activate this option if the values on this level contain multiple values each, e.g. comma-separated lists of keywords and the like.\r\nIf you enable this option, IMatch splits the value into individual values and creates elements for each of these values.
properties.groupdata.level.tokseps:D: Enter a list of separators, separated by a semicolon. If ; is a separator by itself, enter ~; instead.
properties.groupdata.level.trimblanks:D: Enable this setting if you want to remove blanks from the beginning and end of each value.
properties.groupdata.level.useraw:D: If this is set to 'Yes', the original raw data value as stored in the file will be used as the data source. If set to 'No' (Default), the textual value as formatted by ExifTool will be used.
properties.groupdata.level.variable:D: Enter one or more variables or text to determine the elements on this level.
properties.idplate.colors.backgrounddk:D: The background color used for "dark" backgrounds
properties.idplate.colors.backgroundlt:D: If you choose a different color here, you can create a nice "3D effect" for the ID plate
properties.idplate.height:D: The height of the ID plate in pixel
properties.idplate.left.filename:D: The file name of the image you want to show in the left panel of the ID plate
properties.idplate.left.text:D: The text to display. Use <Ctrl>+<Return> to start a new line. The text is shown when no image is loaded.
properties.idplate.right.filename:D: The file name of the image you want to show in the right panel of the ID plate
properties.idplate.right.text:D: The text to display. Use <Ctrl>+<Return> to start a new line.
properties.idplate.visible:D: Shows or hides the Identity plate
properties.imws.documentroot:D: This folder contains all scripts, documents and apps which should be accessible via the embedded IMatch WebServices. The IMatch App Manager also uses this folder to find the system and your apps.
properties.imws.enabled:D: If this setting is off, the embedded IMatch WebServices is disabled. No scripts or apps can work.
properties.imws.port:D: The port number to use for IMWS. If the default port number is already in use on your system, select another number in the range 49152-65535.
properties.objectproperties.category.alias:D: Alias categories don't manage their own file sets. Instead they receive their contents from the Alias source category. If you assign files to an Alias category the files are assigned to the Alias source.
properties.objectproperties.category.aliaslist:D: This property shows the categories which refer to this category via an Alias.
properties.objectproperties.category.assignaction.c: Un-assign the file from all other categories
Un-assign the file from all categories with the same parent category
properties.objectproperties.category.assignaction:D: If you enable <Bold>Un-assign from all</Bold>, a file assigned to this category will be removed from all other categories. <Bold>Un-assign from siblings</Bold> will remove the file from all categories with the same parent.
properties.objectproperties.category.backcolor:D: The background color to use for this category if color-coding is activated.
This category inherits the color-coding settings from the parent category
Color-coding active, hide from File Window
properties.objectproperties.category.datadriven.man: This option tells you whether the category is updated automatically or only by manual refresh. You can change this option in the data-driven properties of this category.
properties.objectproperties.category.datadriven:D: Change the data-driven properties of this category. Click on the button to open the editor dialog.
properties.objectproperties.category.error:D: The category reports an error. Most likely this error is caused by a recursion, which makes the category depend on itself.\nCheck the category and all children for recursion or self-referring aliases.
properties.objectproperties.category.level.autog:D: Enable this if you want to insert an extra level based on the first n characters of each keyword. This is especially helpful when you create levels with hundreds or even thousands of keywords.
properties.objectproperties.category.level.autogsl:: Enter the index of the first character (1..) and the number of characters (1..) you want to use for your auto-group.\r\nGood values are 1,1 or 1,2 for most cases.
properties.objectproperties.category.level.hierseps: Enter a list of hierarchy separators, separated by a semicolon. If ; is a separator by itself, enter ~; instead.
properties.objectproperties.category.level.keepempt: If this option is enabled, empty child categories will be kept when you refresh the data-driven category.
properties.objectproperties.category.level.norm:D: Enable this setting if you want to unify the spelling of the keywords.
properties.objectproperties.category.level.normseps: Enter the characters which separate 'words' in the keywords. Tip: Use {tab} for tabulator, {cr} for carriage return, {lf} for linefeed.
properties.objectproperties.category.level.othernam: Enter the name to use for the 'Other' element. If the name is not unique on a level, IMatch will make it unique by appending a number.
properties.objectproperties.category.level.tok:D: Activate this option if the keywords contain multiple values each, e.g. comma-separated lists of keywords.
properties.objectproperties.category.level.tokseps:: Enter a list of separators, separated by a semicolon. If ; is a separator by itself, enter ~; instead.
properties.objectproperties.category.level.useother: Enable this option if you want to add an 'Other' element containing files without keywords
properties.objectproperties.category.name: Name
properties.objectproperties.category.name:D: The name of this category.\nYou can rename the category by entering a new name here.
properties.objectproperties.category.nocalc:D: If this setting is enabled, the category does not consider images assigned to child categories.
properties.objectproperties.category.sealed:D: If this option is active, the category does not accept direct assignments. All categories with a formula should be sealed to prevent accidental assignments.
properties.objectproperties.category.shortcode:D: Enter a short code to use for this category.
properties.objectproperties.category.textcolor:D: The text color to use for this category if color-coding is activated.
Create keyword from this category, assign files with matching keyword to this category
properties.objectproperties.category.xmpmapping:D: This option controls how IMatch maps categories to IPTC/XMP keywords.
properties.objectproperties.cattree.backcolor.check: The background color used for the 'recursive' check box.
properties.objectproperties.cattree.backcolor:D: The color used for the background of the control.
properties.objectproperties.cattree.showcounts:D: If this option is enabled, IMatch displays the number of files directly assigned to a category, and also calculates the result of the category to display the total number of files contained in the category.
properties.objectproperties.cattree.showthumbnails:: Activate this option to show category thumbnails instead of standard icons.
properties.objectproperties.cattree.sortmode.cd.0x8: This option allows you to reorder the elements in the tree manually to create a custom sort order
properties.objectproperties.cattree.sortmode:D: This property controls how the categories in the tree view are sorted. If in custom sort order you can reorder categories via drag and drop by holding down the Alt key.
properties.objectproperties.cattree.textcolor.check: The text color used for the 'recursive' check box.
properties.objectproperties.cattree.textcolor:D: The text color used for the control.
properties.objectproperties.cattree.thumbnailfillco: The background color used to fill thumbnails, and for folders without thumbnails
properties.objectproperties.cattree.thumbnailframec: The frame color used to fill thumbnails, and for folders without thumbnails
properties.objectproperties.cattree.thumbnailgraysc: Activate this option to display thumbnails in grayscale.
properties.objectproperties.cattree.thumbnailsize:D: Controls the size of category thumbnails.
properties.objectproperties.collnode.name: Name
properties.objectproperties.collnode.tag.tag:D: The name of this tag.\nYou can rename the tag by entering a new name here. All objects using this tag will use the new name automatically.
properties.objectproperties.colltree.showcounts:D: If this option is enabled, IMatch displays the number of files contained in each collection.
properties.objectproperties.db.appidletime:D: The idle time of the application
properties.objectproperties.db.blockcounter:D: The number of blocked database calls so far
properties.objectproperties.db.cache.files.perm:D: The number of files in the permanent disk cache.
properties.objectproperties.db.cache.files.temp:D: The number of files in the temporary disk cache.
properties.objectproperties.db.cache.filesloaded:D: The total number of files loaded and processed by the cache.
properties.objectproperties.db.cache.imc.hits:D: The total number of files loaded from the in-memory cache.
properties.objectproperties.db.cache.imc.maxsize:D: The maximum amount of RAM available for the in-memory cache.
properties.objectproperties.db.cache.imc.size:D: The amount of RAM currently used by the in-memory cache.
properties.objectproperties.db.cache.rootfolder:D: This folder is used to store the preview images for the current database.
properties.objectproperties.db.cache.size.perm:D: The total size of the files in the permanent disk cache.
properties.objectproperties.db.cache.size.temp:D: The total size of the files in the temporary disk cache.
properties.objectproperties.db.categories:D: Number of categories managed by this database.
properties.objectproperties.db.dbidletime:D: The idle time of the database core system
properties.objectproperties.db.files:D: Number of files managed by this database.
properties.objectproperties.db.folders:D: Number of folders managed by this database.
properties.objectproperties.db.managedfilesize:D: The total size of all files managed by this database.
properties.objectproperties.db.name: Database File
properties.objectproperties.db.name:D: File name and folder of the database file.
properties.objectproperties.db.thumbcachesize:D: The current size of the thumbnail cache in memory.
properties.objectproperties.db.updqueue.entries:D: The total number of entries in the processing queue.
properties.objectproperties.db.updqueue.lastfile:D: The name and path of the last processed file.
properties.objectproperties.db.updqueue.processed:D: The number of entries already processed.
properties.objectproperties.db.updqueue.timeavg:D: The average processing time per entry on the processing queue.
properties.objectproperties.db.updqueue.timeremain:: The remaining processing time for all entries in the processing queue.
properties.objectproperties.db.updqueue.timetotal:D: The total processing time until now.
properties.objectproperties.db.updqueue.totalsize:D: The total size of all files processed.
properties.objectproperties.drive.available:D: The available space on this drive. The space available available to you may be limited by a disk quota.
properties.objectproperties.drive.filesystem:D: The file system used for this drive.
properties.objectproperties.drive.free:D: The available space on this drive. The space available to you may be limited by a disk quota.
properties.objectproperties.drive.label: Label
properties.objectproperties.drive.label:D: The media label of the currently inserted media.
properties.objectproperties.drive.name: Drive
properties.objectproperties.drive.name:D: This is a drive node, representing a physical drive connected to your computer or a remote drive on a network server.
properties.objectproperties.drive.serial:D: The serial number of the currently inserted media. This number is written to the media during the initial formatting procedure.
properties.objectproperties.drive.used:D: The used space on this drive
properties.objectproperties.folder.backcolor:D: The background color to use for this folder if color-coding is activated.
properties.objectproperties.folder.colorcoded.cd.2:: This folder inherits the color-coding settings from the parent folder
properties.objectproperties.folder.friendlyname:D: The friendly name of this folder
properties.objectproperties.folder.lastmodified:D: Date and time this folder was last modified (as reported by Windows).
properties.objectproperties.folder.name: Name
properties.objectproperties.folder.name:D: The physical name of this folder.\nYou can rename the folder on the media by entering a new name here.
properties.objectproperties.folder.needsrefresh:D: This property shows 'Yes' if folder needs a rescan because it has been modified, files have been added, removed or updated. Click the button to rescan the folder (Hold down <Ctrl> for more options)
properties.objectproperties.folder.numberoffiles:D: The number of files managed by IMatch in this folder.
properties.objectproperties.folder.offline:D: This property shows 'No' when the media containing the folder is off-line, or the folder has been removed or renamed outside of IMatch.\r\nYou can use the 'Relocate' command to inform IMatch about the new location of the folder in this case.
properties.objectproperties.folder.path:D: The fully qualified path of this folder
properties.objectproperties.folder.subfolders:D: The number of sub-folders of this folder.
properties.objectproperties.folder.textcolor:D: The text color to use for this folder if color-coding is activated.
properties.objectproperties.folder.thumbnail:D: The thumbnail to display for this folder when folder thumbnails are enabled.
properties.objectproperties.folder.totalsize:D: The total number of bytes allocated for the files of this folder.
properties.objectproperties.spc.tamredoe:D: The number of steps in the redo list
properties.objectproperties.spc.tamsize:D: The memory consumed by the task manager
properties.objectproperties.spc.tamundoe:D: The number of steps in the undo list
properties.objectproperties.spc.trmdelfiles:D: Number of files in the recycle bin
properties.objectproperties.spc.trmdelfolders:D: Number of folders in the IMatch recycle bin
properties.objectproperties.timelinenode.comment:D: Enter a comment to show for this element.
properties.objectproperties.timelinenode.icon:D: Select an icon to display for this element.
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.bkcolorfoc: The background color for the focused element
The background color for the focused and highlighted element
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.bkcolorhl:: The background color for highlighted elements
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.bkcolorsel: The background color for selected elements
The background color for selected and highlighted elements
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.invert:D: Change the year order, show current year on top.
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.shortnames: Use short month and week names. Note: IMatch uses the day and month names in the language of the current user.
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.showcommen: If this option is enabled, IMatch displays the comments of each element.
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.showcounts: If this option is enabled, IMatch displays the number of files contained in each segment.
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.showhy:D: If this is enabled, half-years are included in the display.
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.showq:D: If this is enabled, quarters are included in the display.
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.showw:D: If this is enabled, weeks are included in the display.
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.textcolorh: The text color for special elements
The text color for special elements
The text color for highlighted elements
properties.objectproperties.timelinetree.textcolors: The text color for selected elements
The text color for special selected elements
The text color for special highlighted elements
The text color for selected and highlighted elements
properties.panels.colors.backgrounddark.selected:D: The background color used for "dark" backgrounds when there is a selection
properties.panels.colors.backgrounddark:D: The background color used for "dark" backgrounds
properties.panels.colors.backgroundlight:D: The background color used for "light" backgrounds
properties.panels.colors.highlightcolordark:D: The highlight text color used for "dark" backgrounds
properties.panels.colors.highlightcolorlight:D: The highlight text color used for "light" backgrounds
properties.panels.colors.textcolordark.dimmed:D: The dimmed text color used for "dark" backgrounds
properties.panels.colors.textcolordark.readonly:D: The dimmed text color used for read-only elements on dark backgrounds
properties.panels.colors.textcolordark:D: The text color used for "dark" backgrounds
properties.panels.colors.textcolorlight.dimmed:D: The dimmed text color used for "light" backgrounds
properties.panels.colors.textcolorlight.readonly:D: The dimmed text color used for read-only elements on "light" backgrounds
properties.panels.colors.textcolorlight:D: The text color used for "light" backgrounds
properties.thesmgr.properties.elem.assignmode:D: If this option is enabled, sub-elements of this element will be assigned/used as well. This allows you to assign multiple thesaurus elements at once, which can be very useful especially for keywords.
properties.thesmgr.properties.elem.exclude:D: If this option is enabled, this keyword is excluded when IMatch maps hierarchical keywords into the 'flat' keyword structure in IPTC and XMP. This option is only applied if Group Level is not enabled.
properties.thesmgr.properties.elem.group:D: If this option is set, the element works as a group level, for organizational purposes only. The element will not be included when you select entries from the thesaurus.
properties.thesmgr.properties.elem.id:D: The unique id of this element. This id is assigned by the system and cannot be changed.
properties.thesmgr.properties.elem.key:D: The unique key for this elements. Keys are optional and only needed if you work with linked or dependent thesaurus entries.
properties.thesmgr.properties.elem.sortorder:D: The sort order controls how sub-elements of this element are sorted.
properties.thesmgr.properties.entry.id:D: The unique id of this entry. This id is assigned by the system and cannot be changed.
properties.thesmgr.properties.entry.name: Name
properties.thesmgr.properties.entry.name:D: The localized descriptive name this entry.
properties.thesmgr.properties.entry.sortorder:D: The sort order controls how sub-elements of this entry are sorted.
properties.thesmgr.tree.colors.elemalt: Text color for elements in alternative languages
properties.thesmgr.tree.colors.elemalt:D: Text color for elements in alternative languages.
properties.thesmgr.tree.colors.synalt: Text color for synonyms in alternative languages
properties.thesmgr.tree.colors.synalt:D: Text color for synonyms in alternative languages.

strings.AFX_IDS_HELPMODEMESSAGE: Select an object on which to get Help
strings.FILEWND_CAPTION_FILTERTIP: Click the icon to disable the Filter Panel.\nThe file window then shows all files again.

strings.PTR_DBCORE_ALL_DESC: This category represents all files in the database. It cannot be deleted or otherwise manipulated.
strings.PTR_DBCORE_CAT_NOKW_DESC: This category contains all files without keywords (files not in any of the child categories of @Keywords).
strings.PTR_DBCORE_CAT_UNASSIGNED_DESC: This category contains all files not directly assigned to a category.
strings.PTR_DBCORE_CAT_UNCATEGORIZED_DESC: This category contains all files which are not part of any category, including direct assignments, data-driven categories and formula-based categories.
strings.PTR_DBCORE_INTERACTIVE_DESC: This category contains the current result of the Category Builder.
strings.PTR_DBCORE_TAG_DESC: This automatic category contains all Keywords used in your database.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_160: Cannot alias a category with itself.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_209: Error creating a temporary file name.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_211: File already in use and cannot be shared.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_45621: Cannot delete attribute which is referenced by other sets.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_5001: Empty token found. No valid token between " and ".
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_5002: Unknown token found. Please make sure that all formula and function names are spelled correctly.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_501: The database has been opened in read-only mode. No operation or command can be performed which requires a modification of the database contents.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_5013: Object not found while evaluating a formula.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_5014: Recursive category formula. Please make sure that a category formula does not include itself, either directly or indirectly.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_503: Internal application error. Restart IMatch and run a database diagnosis via Database > Tools to ensure that the database is healthy.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_504: The database version is not supported by this version of IMatch.\r\n\r\nMaybe this database was created or updated with a newer version of IMatch?
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_505: The database is exclusively locked by another IMatch user.

strings.PTR_ERRMSG_5101: Too many children for a data-driven category. Please change the category setup to reduce the number of child categories created.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_6000: Invalid file name or resource identifier.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_6003: Failed to delete a file. Make sure the file is not write-protected and that you have sufficient permissions to delete it.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_6007: Failed to delete a folder. Make sure the folder is not write-protected and that you have sufficient permissions to delete it. Windows may be unable to delete a folder when another application has one or more files open in that folder.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_7202: The database is busy and is taking too long to respond.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_COMPRESSION: Error while compressing or de-compressing data.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_CREATEFILE: Error creating a file. Make sure you have write access to the media and folder.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_FILEFORMAT: Unknown package format or package damaged.

strings.PTR_ERRMSG_FRM_DBDIAG_FAILED: Database diagnosis failed. See diagnosis log file for more info.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_FRM_DBOPEN: Failed to open the database '{0}'. See the application log file for more info.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_FRM_DBPHYSDAMAGE: Failed to open the database '{0}'. The database is PHYSICALLY damaged and has to be replaced from a working backup. See the application log file for more info.

strings.PTR_ERRMSG_FRM_VERIFYFILE: Verification of packet for file {0} failed.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_FRM_VERIFYFILE_OPEN: Verification failed. Cannot open package file.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_GENERIC: No specific error message exists for this error. The application log file may provide additional information about this error.

strings.PTR_ERRMSG_PAKETFORMAT: Unknown packet format, package file is corrupted.
strings.PTR_ERRMSG_SHARINGVIOLATION: The file is already open and locked by another application.
