strings.PTR_IMPEXP_GROUPS_EXPORT_DESC: This export module allows you to export your category hierarchy to an XML file. You can optionally include the assigned files so you can import the category hierarchy and file assignments into another database.
strings.PTR_IMPEXP_GROUPS_IMPORT_DESC: This import module allows you to import category hierarchies from IMCS (IMatch 3.x) and IMCSX files (IMatch 5 and later).
strings.PTR_IMPEXP_IMAGEEXPORT_DESC: This module exports images into various file formats and allows you to resize and color-convert. In addition you can add borders, text and image overlays.
strings.PTR_IMPEXP_PRINTING_DESC: With IMatch Design printing you can design and print photo books, contact sheets, reports and many other document types.
strings.PTR_IMPEXP_TEXT_EXPORT_DESC: This module enables you to export metadata into a variety of different text formats, including CSV, JSON and XML.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_ATTRIBUTES_DELETE: You can undelete by pressing <Ctrl>+<Del> again.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_CATEGORIES_DD_EMPTYTAG: You can only enable this level after selecting a valid Metadata Tag.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_CATEGORIES_DD_EMPTYVAR: You can only enable this level after entering a non-empty variable.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_CATEGORIES_SEALHINT: You should seal categories with formulas to prevent accidental manual assignments.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_CHART_COPYPOINT: The files have been copied into to the Windows clipboard.<LineBreak/>You can paste the file name into other applications as text, or copy the files within IMatch, e.g. into a category or Collection.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FAV_COL: Clicking on a collection favorite adds the currently selected set of files in the active file window to the collection. To <Bold>remove</Bold> the images from the collection, use <Shift>+Click.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FAV_FOLDER: Clicking on a folder favorite copies or moves (when the <Shift> key is pressed) all selected files in the active file window to the folder associated with the favorite.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FAV_GROUP: Clicking on a category favorite assigns the currently selected set of files in the active file window to all categories in that favorite. To <Bold>un-assign</Bold>, use <Shift>+Click.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILEWND_CHANGEMDFILTER: You have modified metadata while a filter is active. You may need to re-apply the filter by clicking the green 'Apply the filter' button in the Filter Panel toolbar.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILEWND_DBLCLICK: You can configure the action for double-clicks under Edit > Preferences > File Window.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILEWND_FILTERAUTOPAUSE: The Filter Panel was active and has been paused to show you all results.<LineBreak/>Click the 'Pause' button in the Filter Panel toolbar if you want to apply the current filter to the Result Window.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>You can disable this feature under Edit > Preferences; > File Window.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILEWND_FIND: This command sets the focus to the <Bold>Find Bar</Bold> in the toolbar above the file window. Enter text to start searching.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILEWND_FINDWHILEPAUSED: The File Window is currently paused.<LineBreak/>Click the Pause button to apply the search.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILEWND_RELCOUNTERCLICK: Hold down the Ctrl key while left-clicking this area to toggle the version stack.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILEWND_RESCAN: Hold down the Ctrl key when selecting this command for additional options.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILEWND_RO_OF_OFFLINE: On or more of the files in the current selection are off-line or read-only.<LineBreak/>This command cannot be applied to these files.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILEWND_STACKCOUNTERCLICK: Hold down the Ctrl key while left-clicking this area to toggle the stack.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILTERPANEL_ENABLE: To enable this filter, <Bold>click the checkbox</Bold> in the filter caption bar.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILTERPANEL_HINT: You can enable more filters by clicking on the <Italic>Configure</Italic> button in the toolbar.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILTERPANEL_LOAD: The filter {0} has been loaded into the Active filter.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILTERPANEL_TOOMANYELEMENT: <Bold>Filter Panel</Bold><LineBreak/>There are too many elements to display in the Value Filter for this tag.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_FILTER_ACTIVATESEARCH: Activating this option changes the filter into a <Bold>Search</Bold>.<LineBreak/>The output produced by the filter will be shown in a separate <Italic>Result View</Italic>. You need to manually start the search by clicking on the 'Apply Filter' button in the filter panel toolbar.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_GROUPPANEL_RECENT_ASSIGN: To un-assign files, hold down the <Shift> key while clicking.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_MDPANEL_COPY: This command copies the tag names and values for all tags in the current layout. Hold down the <Alt> key to copy all the data of the current file.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_MDPANEL_TOOMANYFILES: You have selected a large number of files.<LineBreak/>The Metadata Panel shows only the metadata of the focused file and does not attempt merge the metadata of all selected files.\n\nThe changes you make will still be written to all selected files.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_MDPANEL_TOOMANYKEYWORDS: You have selected a large number of files. The Keyword Panel shows only the keywords of the focused file and does not attempt merge the keywords of all selected files.\n\nThe changes you make will still be written to all selected files.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_MDPANEL_WARNMAPPED: This field is mapped to an XMP field and cannot be edited directly.<LineBreak/>Please update the corresponding XMP field instead.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_MDPANEL_WARNUNSAFE: Editing the data in this field is potentially dangerous and may affect other software.<LineBreak/>You should only edit the data when you have good reasons to do so.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_PREVIEW_ALTFLAP: Hold down the <Shift> key when clicking to navigate between the images in stacks (even when they are not in scope). You need to select a stack or version master in the file window first.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_PREVIEW_CTRLPAN: When zoomed you can hold down the <Shift> key for <Italic>faster panning</Italic>.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_RESCAN: Hold down the <Ctrl> key for additional options.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_RESCAN_SUBFOLDERWARNING: The inclusion of sub-folders has been disabled under Edit > Preferences: Indexing. This folder has sub-folders on disk which will not be included in this rescan.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_SEARCH_RERUN: You can re-run the visual query with these parameters and another set of original images with the <Bold>Rerun</Bold> command from the <Bold>Search</Bold> menu ({0}).
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_SLIDESHOW_SINGLESEL: Only one file is selected.<LineBreak/>The slide show will run with all files in the current file window, starting with the selected file.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_VIEWER_EDITTAGINFO: <Bold>Tip:</Bold> Press <F2> to edit the tag for this annotation directly.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_VIEWER_LARGEFILEHINT: You are viewing rather large files.<LineBreak/>You can improve the performance of the Viewer by disabling color management and sharpen via Edit > Preferences > Application: Viewer.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_VIEWER_SINGLESEL: Only one file is selected.<LineBreak/>The Viewer will load all files in the current file window, starting with the selected file.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>You can configure this behavior under Edit > Preferences > Application: Viewer.
strings.PTR_INFOPOPUP_VIEWER_SKIPDEL: You can automatically skip files with the delete mark when navigating with the cursor keys or the mouse wheel. Enable the corresponding option under Edit > Preferences > Application: Viewer.

strings.PTR_MARKUP_DB_STATS:
<Page xmlns='http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation' xmlns:x='http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml'>
					<Page.Resources>

						<Style x:Key='s_border' TargetType='Border'>
							<Setter Property="Background">
								<Setter.Value>
									<LinearGradientBrush EndPoint="0.5, 1" StartPoint="0.5, 0">
										<GradientStop Color="{bkcolor}" Offset="0.8"/>
										<GradientStop Color="{bkcolorlt}" Offset="0"/>
									</LinearGradientBrush>
								</Setter.Value>
							</Setter>
							<Setter Property="Padding">
								<Setter.Value>4,4,4,4</Setter.Value>
							</Setter>
							<Setter Property="Margin">
								<Setter.Value>2,2,2,2</Setter.Value>
							</Setter>
						</Style>

						<Style x:Key='s_text' TargetType="TextBlock">
							<Setter Property="FontSize" Value="12"></Setter>
							<Setter Property="Foreground" Value="{textcolor}"></Setter>
						</Style>

						<Style x:Key='s_headline' TargetType="TextBlock">
							<Setter Property="FontSize" Value="16"></Setter>
							<Setter Property="FontFamily" Value="Tahoma"></Setter>
							<Setter Property="Foreground" Value="{textcolor}"></Setter>
							<Setter Property="HorizontalAlignment" Value="Center"></Setter>
						</Style>


					</Page.Resources>

					<Grid Width="{gwidth}" VerticalAlignment="Top" HorizontalAlignment="Center">

						<Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
							<ColumnDefinition Width="*"/>
						</Grid.ColumnDefinitions>

						<Grid.RowDefinitions>
							<RowDefinition Height="Auto"/>
							<RowDefinition Height="Auto"/>
							<RowDefinition Height="Auto"/>
							<RowDefinition Height="Auto"/>
						</Grid.RowDefinitions>
						<!--
						<Border Grid.Row="0" Padding="0,4,0,4">
							<Border.Background>
								<LinearGradientBrush EndPoint="0.5, 1" StartPoint="0.5, 0">
									<GradientStop Color="{bkcolorlt}" Offset="1"/>
									<GradientStop Color="{bkcolor}" Offset="0"/>
								</LinearGradientBrush>
							</Border.Background>
							<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_headline}" >File Name</TextBlock>
						</Border>
						-->

						<Border Grid.Row="1" Padding="0,4,0,4">
							<TextBlock TextWrapping="Wrap" Style="{StaticResource s_text}" >{dbfile}</TextBlock>
						</Border>

						<Border Grid.Row="2" Padding="0,4,0,4">
							<Border.Background>
								<LinearGradientBrush EndPoint="0.5, 1" StartPoint="0.5, 0">
									<GradientStop Color="{bkcolorlt}" Offset="1"/>
									<GradientStop Color="{bkcolor}" Offset="0"/>
								</LinearGradientBrush>
							</Border.Background>
							<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_headline}" >Statistics</TextBlock>
						</Border>

						<Grid Grid.Row="3" Grid.Column="0">
							<Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
								<ColumnDefinition Width="*"></ColumnDefinition>
								<ColumnDefinition Width="Auto"></ColumnDefinition>
							</Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
							<Grid.RowDefinitions>
								<RowDefinition/>
								<RowDefinition/>
								<RowDefinition/>
								<RowDefinition/>
								<RowDefinition/>
								<RowDefinition/>
								<RowDefinition/>
							</Grid.RowDefinitions>

							<Border Grid.Row="0" Grid.Column="0" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">Folders</TextBlock>
							</Border>
							<Border Grid.Row="0" Grid.Column="1" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">{#folders}</TextBlock>
							</Border>

							<Border Grid.Row="1" Grid.Column="0" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">Files</TextBlock>
							</Border>
							<Border Grid.Row="1" Grid.Column="1" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">{#files}</TextBlock>
							</Border>

							<Border Grid.Row="2" Grid.Column="0" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">Categories</TextBlock>
							</Border>
							<Border Grid.Row="2" Grid.Column="1" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">{#cats}</TextBlock>
							</Border>
							
							<Border Grid.Row="3" Grid.Column="0" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">Total Image Size</TextBlock>
							</Border>
							<Border Grid.Row="3" Grid.Column="1" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">{#totalsize}</TextBlock>
							</Border>
							
							<Border Grid.Row="4" Grid.Column="0" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">Database Size</TextBlock>
							</Border>
							<Border Grid.Row="4" Grid.Column="1" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">{#dbsize}</TextBlock>
							</Border>
							
							<Border Grid.Row="5" Grid.Column="0" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">Ratio</TextBlock>
							</Border>
							<Border Grid.Row="5" Grid.Column="1" Style="{StaticResource s_border}">
								<TextBlock Style="{StaticResource s_text}">{#ratio}%</TextBlock>
							</Border>
						</Grid>
					</Grid>
				</Page>
strings.PTR_MDCONTAINER_BANNER_PENDING: File is currently being updated and cannot be modified.

messages.PTR_MSG_APPMGR_DUPLICATE_ID.caption: Duplicate Application Id detected
messages.PTR_MSG_APPMGR_SERVICEAPP_PROMPT.caption: New or Updated Service App
messages.PTR_MSG_APPMGR_SERVICEAPP_PROMPT.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>App <Bold>{0}</Bold><LineBreak/>loaded from '{1}'.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>This app wants to run in the background. <LineBreak/>It has been started for the first time or it has been modified since the last run.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>Do you allow this app to run?</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_APPMGR_SERVICEAPP_PROMPT.footer: Only run apps from trustworthy sources.
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_APP_DUPEORINVALIDVARIAB: Either a variable with this name already exists or the variable name containes invalid characters. A variable name must consist of alphanumeric characters only.
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_APP_NEWVARIABLE.btn.100: <TextBlock><Bold>String</Bold> Variable<LineBreak/>This type of variable contains text data of variable length.</TextBlock>
<TextBlock><Bold>Numeric</Bold> Variable<LineBreak/>This type of variable contains a positve or negative numeric value.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_APP_NEWVARIABLE.caption: New Variable
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_BACKGROUND_WBWARNING.co: Enabling this feature causes IMatch to always update files when you change metadata in any feature.\r\n\r\nThis may slow down many IMatch features considerably. You should enable this option only when really required.
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_DB_CHANGEGUID.caption: Change Database ID
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_DB_CHANGEGUID.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>Changing the unique id of a database is <Bold>only</Bold> required when you have duplicated an existing database by copying the file on disk.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>Unless you change the database id, both databases will share resources like the file cache, and this <Italic>will cause problems</Italic>.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>Click OK to change the database id and to reload the database automatically.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_DB_PWWARNING.caption: Password Mismatch
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_DB_PWWARNING.content: The first and second password are different. Please check your typing.
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_FF_REMOVE.caption: Format cannot be removed
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_FF_REMOVE.content: This database contains files which use this format. You can only remove this format after removing all files refering to this format from the database.
The regular expressions for skipping folders is invalid.
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_MD2_DEFAULTS.btn.1001: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>Reset only the options in this dialog.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_MD2_DEFAULTS.btn.1002: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>Reset the options in this dialog and also all custom metadata settings I made for individual file formats.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_MD2_DEFAULTS.caption: Metadata Defaults
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_MD2_DEFAULTS.content: Please select one of the following options:
This tag is a structured or complex tag. You cannot write to the tag directly, you need to write to its individual elements separately.
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_MDTEMPLATES_MAPPED.cont: This tag is mapped to an XMP tag and should not be used directly. Use the corresponding XMP tag instead.
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_MDTEMPLATES_REPLACEPROM: Merge\nThe imported templates are appended to the existing templates. Duplicate names are automatically resolved.
Replace\nAll existing templates are removed before importing the new templates.
Your database already contains metadata templates. What do you want to do?
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_MDTEMPLATES_UNSAFETAG.c: This tag is marked by ExifTool as 'unsafe' for write-back. You should not update it. Results are unpredictable.
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_RELDEF_CHANGED.caption: Relations Rules modified
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_RELDEF_CHANGED.content: You have changed the relations rules for your database.\r\nTo apply these changes, use the 'Refresh Relations' command from the Commands menu on individual folders or the entire database. See IMatch Help for details.
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_RELDEF_GLOBALSEARCH.con: <TextBlock>This option will search the entire database to find versions. This is a <Underline>very slow</Underline> operation and you should use this only as the <Bold>last resort</Bold>.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>It is much faster to search only specific folders for potential versions.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_RELDEF_PROPAGATION_WARN: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>Propagating this type of metadata between files may cause problems in combination with certain file formats and/or applications.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>See the IMatch help for details and test the compatibility of the resulting version files with other applications.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_RELDEF_RESET.caption: Restore Default Values
messages.PTR_MSG_APPPREFS_RELDEF_RESET.content: This command deletes all existing relation definitions in the database and loads a set of standard definitions.\r\nDo you want to do that?
messages.PTR_MSG_APPS_CLOSING_WARNING.caption: Apps Closing
messages.PTR_MSG_APPS_CLOSING_WARNING.content: One or more apps ask to keep IMatch running. This may happen if an app is in the middle of something and not yet ready to close. Usually it helps to wait for a few seconds and then to try closing IMatch again.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_BUSY_BACKGROUNDTASK.caption: IMatch is busy
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_BUSY_BACKGROUNDTASK.content: IMatch cannot perform this operation at this time. Another task is running in the background and IMatch has to wait for its completion.\n\nPlease try again in a few seconds.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_HIGH_RES_DETECT.btn.1001: Yes\nConfigure IMatch to use larger icons and toolbars.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_HIGH_RES_DETECT.btn.1002: No\nI want to configure these settings myself.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_HIGH_RES_DETECT.caption: IMatch : Adjust to Display Size
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_HIGH_RES_DETECT.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>You work with a <Bold>high-resolution display</Bold>.<LineBreak/>To improve readability we suggest that IMatch is configured to use larger icons, toolbars and font sizes.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/><Bold>Note:</Bold> You can change these settings any time via Edit menu > Preferences > Application.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_INFO_BACKGROUNDPROCESSING.co: IMatch now processes the data of the new and updated files in a separate background task.\n\nYou can continue to use IMatch, but you may notice short delays while peforming certain functions in IMatch. Check out the status bar and the 'Info & Activity Panel' to control the processing progress.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_RESCAN_KEEP_OFFLINE.caption: Removal of off-line files disabled
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_RESCAN_KEEP_OFFLINE.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>You have disabled the automatic removal of off-line files under <Bold>Edit > Prefereces > Indexing</Bold>. IMatch keeps all files in the database, even when you manually rescan a folder.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_RESTART.btn.1001: Restart IMatch.\nIMatch closes and restarts automatically.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_RESTART.btn.1002: Just close IMatch.\nUse this option if you want to start IMatch yourself later.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_RESTART.caption: Restart required
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_RESTART.content: IMatch has to restart to apply these changes.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_RUN_ON_EXIT.caption: Permission to run
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_RUN_ON_EXIT.footer: If this operation was triggerd by something you did, this is most likely OK. If this is unexpected, you should not allow it for security reasons.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_TELEMETRY_CONSTENT.btn.1001: Cool! Allow IMatch to collect anonymous usage data.\nYou can change this setting anytime under Edit > Preferences > Application.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_TELEMETRY_CONSTENT.btn.1002: I want to learn more about how IMatch uses telemetry.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_TELEMETRY_CONSTENT.btn.1003: I want to disable telemetry.\nPlease don't! The data gathered by IMatch is not linked to your person and helps us a lot to improve the product for all users.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_TELEMETRY_CONSTENT.caption: Telemetry
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_TELEMETRY_CONSTENT.content:
We use telemetry to record ANONYMOUS usage data. This helps us to understand better how IMatch is used and to improve the software for all users.

The data transmitted to photools.com is anonymous and not linked to your user or community account. We cannot (and don't want to) identify you from telemetry data.

Click on the 2nd button below to learn more about how telemetry works and why it is so important.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_TELEMETRY_NOPROMPT.caption: Telemetry
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_TELEMETRY_NOPROMPT.content:
Please reconsider enabling telemetry.

The anonymous data helps us to better understand how users work with IMatch and to continuously improve the product.

Do you want to see the telemetry information again?
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_TRIAL_EXPIRED.btn.1001: Buy IMatch now.\nBuy IMatch safely via our secure online shop.\nImmediate download of the licensed version after purchase.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_TRIAL_EXPIRED.caption: Your 30-day trial period has expired.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_TRIAL_EXPIRED.content: From now on, IMatch opens all databases older than 30 days in read-only mode and disables some other IMatch features as well.\n\nIf you want to continue using IMatch, please buy a license now. The licensed version opens all databases in fully writable mode again.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_UPDATECHECK_FAILED.caption: Update Check failed
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_UPDATECHECK_FAILED.content: IMatch could not establish a connection with the update server. Please check your Internet connection and firewall settings.\r\n\r\nTip: Use the customer portal at https://www.photools.com to check for updates manually.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_UPDATECHECK_OK.caption: Update Check
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_UPDATECHECK_OK.content: The installed version of IMatch is up-to-date.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_UPDATECHECK_OUTDATED.btn.100: Open Customer Portal Website\nHere you can manage and download your licensed products.
View Release Notes\nLearn about the changes and added features in the new IMatch version.
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_UPDATECHECK_OUTDATED.caption: Update Check
messages.PTR_MSG_APP_UPDATECHECK_OUTDATED.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>A newer version of IMatch is available.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>The current version is <Bold>{0}</Bold>, released on <Bold>{1}</Bold>.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>{2}</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_ASSIST_FIRSTRUN.btn.1001: Create Your Database\nRun the Database Wizard which guides you through the database creation process.
messages.PTR_MSG_ASSIST_FIRSTRUN.btn.1003: Open the Help System\nThis brings up the extensive IMatch Help system with information for new users.
messages.PTR_MSG_ASSIST_FIRSTRUN.btn.1004: Close this dialog\nChoose this if you prefer to work on your own
messages.PTR_MSG_ASSIST_FIRSTRUN.btn.1005: Watch free IMatch Video Tutorials\nThis opens the IMatch Learning Center web site in your web browser.
messages.PTR_MSG_ASSIST_FIRSTRUN.caption: IMatch says Hello!
messages.PTR_MSG_ASSIST_FIRSTRUN.content: This is the first time you have run IMatch. To get started, IMatch needs to create a database which later holds all the information about your files. After the database has been created, you can show IMatch the files you want to manage.
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_ATTR_DELETE.caption: Delete Attribute
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_ATTR_DELETE.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>Do you really want to delete the attribute '{0}'?<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>This will delete the attribute and all data stored in the database for this attribute. <Bold>This operation cannot be undone!</Bold></TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_ATTR_DUPE.caption: Duplicate Name
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_ATTR_DUPE.content: This name is already in use. Attribute names must be unique within their set.
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_ATTR_UNIQUECONSTRAINT: The values of this attribute must be unique.
The data cannot be inserted because it would create duplicate attributes.\nOne or more attributes have unique constraints.
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_BROWSER_MOIFIEDPROMPT: One or more values have been modified.\r\nDo you really want to cancel these changes?
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_CHANGE_NAME.caption: Name Change
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_CHANGE_NAME.content: Changing the name of an attribute can cause problems if you used that attribute in variables.\n\nDo you really want to change the name?
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_EXPORT_FAILURE.conten: An error occurred while writing to the export file. Make sure there is sufficient disk space and check the IMatch logfile for additional details.
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_EXPORT_SELPROMPT.cont: Only one item is selected. Do you want to export all items instead?
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_IM3IMP_ERROR.caption: Error
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_IM3IMP_ERROR.content:
An error occurred while importing the schema file.

Please make sure the file is in the right format and accessible.
See the IMatch log file for additional information.
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_IM3IMP_MODE.btn.1001: Map data using the file name\nThis is the best and fastest method. Use it unless the files in this database are on a different media or in a different folder than before.
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_IM3IMP_MODE.btn.1002: Map via CRC checksum\nThis method maps the data to files by comparing checksums. This will work even if the files have been moved, but there is a small risk that two files share the same checksum and data gets mapped to the wrong file.
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_IM3IMP_MODE.caption: Import Settings
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_IM3IMP_MODE.content: If the schema file contains 'per-file' data IMatch will import this data as well. Please choose how IMatch should map the data to files:
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_LARGERESULTSET.conten: The number of attributes to load is {0}. It can take a while to load this amount of data.\r\nDo you want to continue?
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_LINK.caption: Hyperlink
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_LINK.content: Double-click the link to open the target in the default web browser.
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_NAME_INVALD.caption: Invalid Name
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_NAME_INVALD.content: Set and attribute names may not be empty and should consist only of letters, digits and selected characters. See the Help for details.
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_PASTE_INVALID.caption: Invalid Format
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_PASTE_INVALID.content: The data in the clipboard cannot be inserted.
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_REMOVE_REFATTR.conten: There are Attribute Sets which contain references to this Attribute:\r\n{0}
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_REMOVE_REFVAL.caption: Cannot Remove Active Reference!
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_REMOVE_REFVAL.content: There are files which refer to this value in their Attributes.\r\n\r\nLocate these files and change the references to another value before deleting this value.
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_SET_DELETE.caption: Delete Set
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_SET_DELETE.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>Do you really want to delete the set '{0}'?<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>This will delete the set and all contained attributes and data. <Bold>This operation cannot be undone!</Bold></TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_SET_DUPE.caption: Duplicate Name
messages.PTR_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_SET_DUPE.content: This name is already in use. Attribute sets must use unique names.
messages.PTR_MSG_BACKUP_REMINDER.btn.1002: Skip this time.\nDon't backup now but remind me again when I close IMatch the next time.
messages.PTR_MSG_BACKUP_REMINDER.btn.1003: Skip backup until next time.\nDon't backup and wait for the next regular backup reminder.
messages.PTR_MSG_BACKUP_REMINDER.caption: Backup Reminder
messages.PTR_MSG_BACKUP_REMINDER.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>Do you want to run a backup after IMatch has closed?<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>IMatch automatically launches <Bold>IMatch Pack & Go</Bold>, which enables you to backup your database(s), settings, presets, scripts, Apps and other important IMatch data comfortably.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/><Bold>Note:</Bold> You can configure the backup reminder under Edit > Preferences > Application.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_CACHEMANAGER_PURGEREBUILD.btn.10: Purge\nRemoves cached data for all files in the current selection. IMatch re-creates cache entries automatically on demand.

Rebuild
Removes and re-creates the cache for all files in the current selection.
Use this option if you want to force an update of all cache images, e.g. after changing the global cache options.
This option overrides the 'on-demand' cache setting.
messages.PTR_MSG_CACHEMANAGER_PURGEREBUILD.conten: You can either remove all cached data or re-create it using the current cache settings:
messages.PTR_MSG_CACHEMANAGER_PURGEREBUILD_JPEG.b: Purge\nRemoves cached data for all files in the current selection. IMatch re-creates cache entries automatically on demand.

Rebuild
Removes and re-creates the cache for all files in the current selection.
Use this option if you want to force an update of all cache images, e.g. after changing the global cache options.
This option overrides the 'on-demand' cache setting.

Rebuild (including JPEG files)\nLike 'Rebuild' but also creates cache images for JPEG files. Use this if you intent to take a media or folder off-line and you want to create cache images before you do that.
messages.PTR_MSG_CACHEMANAGER_PURGEREBUILD_JPEG.c: You can either remove all cached data or re-create it using the current cache settings:
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_ALIAS_CHAIN.caption: Cannot Alias an Aliased Category
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_ALIAS_CHAIN.content: You cannot alias a category which is itself an alias of another category or which has depending aliases.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_ALIAS_SELF.caption: Cannot Alias Self
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_ALIAS_SELF.content: A category cannot be an Alias of itself.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DATA_NOLEVEL.caption: No active level
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DATA_NOLEVEL.content: You need to activate at least one level.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DATA_REFRESHALL.caption: Refresh Data-driven Categories
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DATA_RESET.btn.1001: Drop child categories\nThis option removes all child categories from the selected category after converting it to a normal category.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DATA_RESET.btn.1002: Keep child categories\nUse this option if the category should keep its child categories.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DATA_RESET.caption: Convert Category
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DATA_RESET.content: Please choose one of these options:
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DATA_RESET.footer: If you keep the child categories they will no longer be automatically updated.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DELETE.caption: Confirm Category Deletion
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DELETE.content: <TextBlock>Do you really want to delete the category<LineBreak/><Bold>{0}</Bold>?</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DELETE.footer: This operation deletes the category and all child categories from the database.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DELETE_ALIAS.caption: Alias Categories Found
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DELETE_ALIAS.content: One or more categories refer to this category via an Alias. These categories will be deleted when you delete this category.\n\nDo you want to continue?
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DELETE_ALIASMULTI.conte: One or more Alias categories refer to one or more of the category you are going to delete. The Alias categories will also be deleted when you delete this category.\n\nDo you want to continue?
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DELETE_MULTI.caption: Confirm Category Deletion
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DELETE_MULTI.content: Do you really want to delete all selected categories?
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DELETE_MULTI.footer: This operation deletes all selected categories and their child categories from the database.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_COLLECTION.btn.100: Create a category with a formula\nThe resulting category will use a formula to reference the dropped collection.
Assign Images\nAssign all images currently in the collection to the selected category
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_COLLECTION.caption: Collection Drop
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_COLLECTION.content: You have dropped a collection and now have several options to choose from:
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FILES.btn.1001: Assign Files\nAssign the files to the selected category.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FILES.btn.1002: New Category\nCreate a new category as a child to the selected category and assign the files to the new category.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FILES.caption: File Paste or Drop
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FILES.content: You have dropped or pasted a selection of one or more files and now have several options to choose from:
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FOLDER.btn.1001: Create category with a folder formula\nThe resulting category will use a formula to return all images in the dropped folder.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FOLDER.btn.1002: Create category with a recursive folder formula\nThe resulting category will use a formula to return all images in the dropped folder and its sub-folders.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FOLDER.btn.1003: Assign Images\nAssign all images currently in the dropped folder to the selected category.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FOLDER.btn.1004: Assign Images Recursively\nAssign all images currently in the dropped folder and its sub-folders to the selected category.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FOLDER.caption: Folder Drop
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FOLDER.content: You have dropped a folder and now have several options to choose from:
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FOLDERS.btn.1001: Assign Files\nAssign the files contained in this folder to the selected category.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FOLDERS.btn.1002: New Category\nCreate a new category below the selected category and assign the files to the new category.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FOLDERS.btn.1003: New Category with formula\nCreate a new category and set it to use a folder formula referencing the folder.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FOLDERS.caption: Folder Paste or Drop
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DROP_FOLDERS.content: You have dropped or pasted a folder and now have several options to choose from:
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DUPLICATENAME.caption: Duplicate Category Name
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_DUPLICATENAME.content: Category names must be unique among the child categories of a parent category.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_HIDEACTIVE.caption: Empty categories are hidden by filter
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_HIDEACTIVE.content: To see the new category, disable the 'hide empty categries' filter.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_INVALIDNAME.caption: Invalid Category Name
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_INVALIDNAME.content: The given name is not a valid name for a category, or there already exists a category with this name for the parent category.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_INVALIDNAME.info: A category name should consist of letters and digits, but must not include the following characters: " @ |
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_PANEL_RECENT_ASSIGNFILE: <TextBlock>This command <Underline>adds</Underline> the categories of the file you clicked to all currently selected files.<LineBreak/>Hold down the <Shift> key to <Underline>replace</Underline> the categories of all selected files with the categories of the clicked file.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_RESTORESORTORDER.btn.10: Remove\nRemoves the custom sort order for the selected categories.
Reset\nResets the custom sort order for the selected categories to the currently active sort order.
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_RESTORESORTORDER.conten: Please choose one of these options
messages.PTR_MSG_CATEGORY_RESTORESORTORDER_MODE.c: The category view is currently in custom sort order mode. You cannot use the Reset command in this mode.\n\nSwitch to one of the automatic sort modes and then run the command again.
messages.PTR_MSG_COLL_RENAME_FACE_TAG.caption: Rename Face Annotation
messages.PTR_MSG_COLL_RENAME_FACE_TAG.content:
This command allows you to rename a face annotation tag in your entire database.
IMatch also updates the corresponding XMP region metadata and associated keywords for you.

Example uses: Correcting a misspelled name or changing the name of a person after marriage.
messages.PTR_MSG_COLL_TAG_DUPLICATENAME.caption: Duplicate Tag
messages.PTR_MSG_COLL_TAG_DUPLICATENAME.content: This tag already exists. Please choose a unique tag name.
messages.PTR_MSG_CREATE_DB_OK.btn.1001: Adobe Lightroom® Importer\nI want to import my Lightroom catalog into this IMatch database.
messages.PTR_MSG_CREATE_DB_OK.caption: The database is now ready to use
messages.PTR_MSG_CREATE_DB_OK.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>The database has been successfully created and you can now start indexing your files.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>Use the <Bold>Commands menu > Add or Update Folders</Bold> command or just <Bold>drag and drop folders</Bold> from Windows Explorer into the Media & Folders View.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>Press <F1> for more information.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_CTRLSTARTUP.btn.1001: Start without Database\nChoose this option when you want to start IMatch without loading a database and without running application and database scripts.
messages.PTR_MSG_CTRLSTARTUP.btn.1002: Reset Workspace\nChoose this option when you want to reset your workspace settings (windows and panel layouts) back to default values.
messages.PTR_MSG_CTRLSTARTUP.btn.1003: Reset All Settings\nThis option resets all settings for the current user back to safe factory defaults.
messages.PTR_MSG_CTRLSTARTUP.btn.1004: Disable Service Apps\nThis option disables background apps for this session. Useful for debugging.
messages.PTR_MSG_CTRLSTARTUP.caption: Ctrl key pressed
messages.PTR_MSG_CTRLSTARTUP.content: Do you want to perform some special repair operations?
messages.PTR_MSG_CTRLSTARTUP.footer: Choose one of the options above when you experience problems running IMatch, or you want to reset settings back to default values for other reasons.
messages.PTR_MSG_DBREADONLY_NOAVAIL.caption: Database is read-only
messages.PTR_MSG_DBREADONLY_NOAVAIL.content: This feature cannot be used with read-only databases.
messages.PTR_MSG_DBREADONLY_ROONDISK.caption: Database is read-only
messages.PTR_MSG_DBREADONLY_ROONDISK.content: The database file on disk is marked as read-only or the current user has no write privileges to the database file.
messages.PTR_MSG_DBREADONLY_ROONDISK.info: If this is unexpected, check the file system permissions for your user account. The user under which you run IMatch must have read/write/modify access to both the folder containing the database file and the database file itself.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_CACHEFOLDER_DOESNOTEXIST.cont: The cache folder\r\n'{0}'\r\nfor this database does not exist. Please check your settings under Edit > Preferences > Cache.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_CLEAR_QUEUES.btn.1001: Clear file queue\nAll files will be marked as up-to-date and removed from the update queue.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_CLEAR_QUEUES.btn.1002: Clear metadata write-back queue\nAll files with pending metadata changes will be marked as current without writing metadata back to the file.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_CLEAR_QUEUES.caption: Clear Processing Queues
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_CLEAR_QUEUES.content: This command allows you to clear the background processing queues for files and metadata.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_CLEAR_QUEUES.verify: Only for selected files in the active file window
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_COMPACT_DISKSPACE.caption: Insufficient disk space
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_COMPACT_DISKSPACE.content: To run the database compact operation, IMatch temporarily needs {0} MB of free disk space on drive {1}.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_COMPACT_FAILED.caption: Compact failed
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_COMPACT_FAILED.content: The operation failed. Most likely there was not enough disk space available on the disk containing the database.\n\nThe IMatch Log file contains additional information.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_DELETE_CANNOTDELETEOPENDB.con: Unable to delete an open database. Please close the database first.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_DELETE_PROMPT.caption: Delete Database
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_DELETE_PROMPT.content: This command allows you to conveniently delete an IMatch database.\r\n\r\nThe IMDB file, database-specific settings, cache files and other permanent and temporary files associated with the chosen database will be physically deleted.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_DELETE_PROMPT2.caption: Delete Database
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_DELETE_PROMPT2.content: <TextBlock>Are you sure that you want to delete the database<LineBreak/><LineBreak/><Bold>{0}</Bold><LineBreak/><LineBreak/>and all associated files from your disk?<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>This operation cannot be undone!</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_DIAG_TRIM.btn.1001: Remove superfluous data now.\nRun a Compact afterwards to reduce the database file size.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_DIAG_TRIM.btn.1002: Don't remove the data in this diagnosis run.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_DIAG_TRIM.btn.1003: Don't remove the data and don't ask again.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_DIAG_TRIM.caption: Trimming Tag Data
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_DIAG_TRIM.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping="Wrap">You have changed the tag groups and tags IMatch imports into to the database (under <Bold>Edit > Preferences > Metadata 2: Tag Manager</Bold>).<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>If the database contains data for tags which are no longer imported, this extra data will be removed during the diagnosis. This reduces the amount of data stored in the database and improves performance. See the <Bold>Tag Manager help</Bold> for details.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_ET_VERSIONDETECT.caption: New ExifTool version found
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_ET_VERSIONDETECT.content: An newer version of ExifTool was installed and IMatch will now update the database to incorporate the changes to tag definitions.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_FTS_REBUILD.caption: Rebuild Search Engine Index
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_FTS_REBUILD.content:
This command rebuilds the search engine index in the database. This may be necessary when you have changed the options for the search engine.

Depending on the size of your database and the speed of your computer this progress can take a while.

Do you want to run this process now?
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_HOTJOURNALS.caption: Database was not closed correctly.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_HOTJOURNALS.content:
The database had to rollback unfinished operations during the open procedure. This may happen if IMatch was not closed correctly.

Please run the Database Diagnosis (Database menu, Database Tools) to verify that the database is OK.

Do you want to do that now?
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_PANIC.caption: Severe Database Problems detected!
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_PANIC.content:
The database engine has reported potential damage to the database file on disk.

This can happen because of a disk malfunction, network transmission error, application error or similar causes.

Please run the Database Diagnosis (Database menu, Database Tools) immediately to check your database for problems. If problems are found which cannot be repaired, restore the last available backup of the database.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_PANIC_DISKFULL.caption: Disk is full!
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_PANIC_DISKFULL.content:
The database engine has reported potential damage to the database file on disk.

The disk containing the database has run out of space and IMatch could not complete a write operation.

Please free up some space on the disk and then run the Database Diagnosis (Database menu, Database Tools) to check your database for problems. If problems are found which cannot be repaired, restore the last available backup of the database.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_PANIC_EXIFTOOL.caption: Problem Running ExifTool!
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_PANIC_EXIFTOOL.content: This external application is used by IMatch to read and write metadata.\r\n\r\nPlease run a repair of IMatch via the Windows control panel. Also make sure that no anti-virus software or software execution policies active on your computer prevent IMatch from launching external programs.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_PANIC_PORTABILITY.caption: Failed to apply Portability Options
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_READONLY.caption: Database read-only
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_READONLY.content: This database has been opened in read-only mode. All features which modify the database have been disabled.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_READONLY_INFO.caption: Read-only mode is now active.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_READONLY_INFO.content: All databases loaded from now on will be loaded in read-only mode.\n\nDo you want to reopen the current database now to switch it to read-only mode?
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_READONLY_INFO2.caption: Read-only mode is now off.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_READONLY_INFO2.content: Datebases are opened in writable mode from now on.\n\nDo you want to reload the current database?
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_REPAIR_FAIL.caption: Repair failed.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_REPAIR_FAIL.content: The database is damaged beyond repair. Please restore the last working backup copy.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_REPAIR_INFO.caption: Database Repair
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_REPAIR_INFO.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>This command <Italic>attempts</Italic> to repair an IMatch database which has been reported as damaged or which does no longer open. It may be successful if the database file has only damaged index data or the corruption is in a non-vital part of the database file.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/><Bold>Use this command only as a last resort! If you have a backup copy of your database, please use it instead.</Bold></TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_REPAIR_OPENDB.caption: Database is open
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_REPAIR_OPENDB.content: You cannot repair an open database. Please close the database first.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_REPAIR_SUCCESS.caption: Success!
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_REPAIR_SUCCESS.content: The database has been successfully repaired. You should open it in IMatch and run a database diagnosis.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_RUNDIAG.caption: Database Diagnosis
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_TIMELINE_REBUILD.caption: Rebuild Timeline
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_TIMELINE_REBUILD.content:
This command rebuilds the timeline data for your database. This may be necessary when the timeline becomes damaged or has to be updated after structural changes in the database.

Depending on the size of your database and the speed of your computer this progress takes about one minute per 100.000 files.

Do you want to run this process now?
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_UPDATE_5_2_10_TAGMAN.caption: 5.2.10: New features added
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_UPDATE_5_2_10_TAGMAN.content: This version introduces the Tag Manager and changes how and how much metadata IMatch imports. Press F1 for more info.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_UPDATE_5_2_8_FACE.btn.1001: Show the new options in 'Metadata 2' now.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_UPDATE_5_2_8_FACE.btn.1002: I will check the new options later.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_UPDATE_5_2_8_FACE.caption: 5.2.8: New features added
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_UPDATE_5_2_8_FACE.content: This version introduces import features for face regions in XMP metadata. Regions can be automatically converted into IMatch Annotations, tags associated with the imported regions can be added as keywords and more...\r\n\r\nYou may want to configure the new options added in order to support these features.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_UPDATE_5_2_8_FACE.footer: Please press <F1> to read all about the new features.
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_VISUALQUERY_REBUILD.caption: Rebuild Visual Query Data
messages.PTR_MSG_DB_VISUALQUERY_REBUILD.content:
This command rebuilds the visual query data for your database. This may be necessary when IMatch introduces new or better visual query technologies.

Depending on the size of your database and the speed of your computer this progress can take a while.

Do you want to run this process now?
messages.PTR_MSG_DROPFILES.caption: Drag and Drop Operation
messages.PTR_MSG_DROPFILES.content: You have dropped folders and/or files. Do you want to add these objects to your database?
messages.PTR_MSG_DROPFILES.footer: Folders and files already indexed by the database will be updated. New folders and files will be added using the standard Indexing options.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_CREATEDB.caption: Error
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_CREATEDB.content: An error {err} occured while creating the database\n{fn}
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_CREATEDB.footer: Please check that you have sufficient privileges to create files in the given folder and that there is sufficient disk space.\nThe error message gives more information about the actual error.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_CREATEDB_FILEEXISTS.caption: Replace existing database
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_CREATEDB_FILEEXISTS.content: <TextBlock>The file <Bold>{fn}</Bold> already exists!<LineBreak/>Are you sure you want to replace this file?</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_INVALIDFILEFORMAT.caption: Invalid File Format
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_INVALIDFILEFORMAT.content: The file is not in the right format or damaged.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_INVALIDNAME_ALNUM.caption: Invalid Name
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_INVALIDNAME_ALNUM.content: The name you have entered is not a valid name in this context.\nPlease enter a non-empty string, consisting of alphanumerical characters, digits or '_' or '-'.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_INVALIDVERSION.caption: Invalid database version.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_INVALIDVERSION.content: This database was created or updated by a newer IMatch version. It cannot be opened with this version of IMatch.\r\n\r\nPlease download and install the most recent version of IMatch.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_LOCKEDDB.caption: Database is locked or write-protected.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_LOCKEDDB.content: The database is locked and cannot be opened. Please close other applications which may have the database open and then retry.\r\n\r\nAnother reason for this error are insufficient file system privleges. The user working with IMatch must have 'read/write/modify' privileges for the folder containing the database. Press F1 for more info.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_LOCKEDDB_IMWS.caption: Database is locked or write-protected.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_LOCKEDDB_IMWS.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping="Wrap" >The database is locked and cannot be opened. Please close other applications which may have the database open and then retry.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>IMatch has detected that <Bold>IMatch WebServices™</Bold> are running on this computer. Probably the database is currently in use by IMatch WebServices.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>Another reason for this error are insufficient file system privleges. The user working with IMatch must have 'read/write/modify' privileges for the folder containing the database. Press F1 for more info.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_MIGRATEAPP.caption: Critical Error - Application Migration
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_MIGRATEAPP.content: An error occurred while IMatch tried to migrate settings and configuration data from an older IMatch version.\r\n\r\nPlease see the IMatch log file for details. Make a copy of the log file now via the Help > Support menu and include the log file in your email to support.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_NEEDMIGRATION.caption: Database Upgrade Required.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_NEEDMIGRATION.content:
This database was created by an older IMatch version and needs to be updated in order to work with the current version.

IMatch cannot do this when the database is opened in READ-ONLY mode. Please open the database in writable mode or ask your Administrator.

NOTE: The Trial version of IMatch opens databases older than 30 days always in read-only mode, it cannot be used to upgrade old databases. You can create a new database for testing purposes.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_OPENDB.caption: Error
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_OPENDB.content: An error occured while opening the database {fn}:\n\n{err}
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_OPENDB.footer: Probably the database file is locked by another application or you don't have sufficient permissions to open the file.\nThe error message gives more information about the actual error.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_RUNTIME.caption: Error
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_SAVEFILE.caption: Failed to save file
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_SAVEFILE.content: There was an error saving the file.\r\nPlease make sure that there is sufficient disk space available, the media is writable and you have sufficient rights to save data on the media.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTENGINE.caption: Critical Error
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTENGINE.content: An error occured while attempting to start the database engine.\nIMatch cannot continue.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTENGINE.footer: Please check the application log file for further information.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTENGINE.info: This error may be caused by a missing or damaged configuration file, outdated or missing components and similar issues. Try to repair your installation via the Windows Control Panel > Add/Remove Software.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTFOLDERS.caption: Critical Error
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTFOLDERS.info: If you have configured IMatch to use folders on a server or NAS system, make sure the system is online and can be reached. You may also try to repair your IMatch installation via the Windows control panel. Or start IMatch while holding down CTRL and reset all settings back to default values.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTPIM.caption: Critical Error
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTPIM.content: An error occured while attempting to start the plug-in manager.\nIMatch cannot continue.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTPIM.footer: Please check the application log file for further information.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTPIM.info: This error may be caused by a missing or damaged configuration file, outdated or missing components and similar issues. Try to repair your installation via the Windows Control Panel > Add/Remove Software.
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTPTS.caption: Critical Error
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTPTS.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping="NoWrap">An error occured while attempting to open the global settings database:<LineBreak/><LineBreak/><Bold>{0}</Bold><LineBreak/><LineBreak/>IMatch cannot continue. Check the application log file for additional information.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_ERR_STARTPTS.info: Most likely there is a problem with Windows security and the file cannot be written by the current user. Please check the security settings of the file in Windows Explorer and make sure every user has write access to that file. If this does not help, restore the file from your last backup or the last-known-good copy in '{1}'. Or delete it so IMatch can start with a fresh settings database.
messages.PTR_MSG_EXIFTOOLDLG_INCOMPAT.caption: Invalid Arguments
messages.PTR_MSG_EXIFTOOLDLG_INCOMPAT.content: You cannot combine the 'Run for each file' mode with the {Files} or {XMPFiles} variables.\r\n\r\nUse {File.FullName} or similar to address the current file in each run.
messages.PTR_MSG_EXIFTOOLDLG_MANYFILESWARNING.con: You are processing a large number of files in one batch. While this can improve ExifTool performance, it may also cause long execution times. IMatch may abort ExifTool if it takes too long to respond. Try to keep execution times of your argument files under 2 minutes. Use smaller sets of files, or switch to the 'once per file' mode.
messages.PTR_MSG_EXIFTOOLDLG_PROMPT.caption: Warning
messages.PTR_MSG_EXIFTOOLDLG_PROMPT.content: The commands in this preset modify or delete data.\r\nDo you want to run it anyway?
messages.PTR_MSG_EXIFTOOLDLG_SAVEPRESET.caption: Preset modified
messages.PTR_MSG_EXIFTOOLDLG_SAVEPRESET.content: <TextBlock>Do you want to save the changes to preset <Bold>{0}</Bold>?</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_APP_ERROR.caption: Cannot find or start {0}
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_APP_ERROR.content: Please check the Windows shortcut to which this favorite refers and make sure that it points to a valid application.\r\n\r\n{1}
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_DELETEFAVSET.caption: Delete Favorite Set
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_DELETEFAVSET.content: Are you sure you want to delete the active favorite set?
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_DELETEFAVSET_SYS.caption: System Favorite Set
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_DELETEFAVSET_SYS.content: This is a system-controlled favorite set. You cannot delete it, just hide it.
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_GROUPDROP.btn.1001: Create Splasher\nCombines all dropped categories into a Splasher favorite.
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_GROUPDROP.btn.1002: Create individual favorites\nCreates one favorite for each dropped category.
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_GROUPDROP.caption: Category Drop
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_GROUPDROP.content: You have dropped more than one category. What do you want to do?
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_HOTKEY_EDIT_DUPLICATE_KEY.c:
This keybord shortcut is already associated with the favorite '{0}'.
If this shortcut is in the same favorite set or you load the sets containing these favorites at the same time, it is undefined which favorite is executed when you enter the keyboard shortcut.

Do you want to assign this shortcut anyway?
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_HOTKEY_EDIT_RESERVED_KEY.co: The following keybord shortcuts are reserved for the system:\r\n<C> / <Shift>+<C>, <F> / <Shift>+<F>.
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_LNK_ADVERTISED.caption: This is not the right kind of shortcut
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_LNK_ADVERTISED.content: IMatch supports 'real' shortcuts to applications files (.exe) only. The shortcut you have dropped looks like a shortcut to Windows Installer.\r\n\r\nTo use the application with IMatch, create a shortcut to the application executable file somewhere (e.g. on the Windows desktop) and then drag this shortcut to the Favorites panel.
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_PASTESYSTEMFAV.caption: System Favorite Set
messages.PTR_MSG_FAVS_PASTESYSTEMFAV.content: This favorite set is managed by the system. You cannot add favorites to it.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_COPYFILE.caption: Copying File(s)
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_COPYFOLDER.caption: Copying Folder(s)
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_COPYFOLDER.footer: IMatch also copies all the data and meta data associated with the files in the folder.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_DELETEFILE.caption: Deleting file(s) and removing associated data.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_DELETEFOLDER.caption: Deleting Folder(s)
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_GENERAL.caption: Performing Operation
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_MOVEFILE.caption: Moving File(s)
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_MOVEFOLDER.caption: Moving Folder(s)
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_RELOCATEFOLDER.caption: Relocating Folder(s)
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_REMOVEFOLDER.caption: Removing Folder(s)
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_RENAMEFILE.caption: Renaming File(s)
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOPUI_RENAMEFOLDER.caption: Renaming Folder(s)
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_CANT_DELETE_OFFLINE.capti: One or more files are off-line
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_CANT_DELETE_OFFLINE.conte: You cannot delete off-line files. To remove off-line files from your database, rescan the folder containing these files.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_COPYATTR_ONLINEWRITABLE.c: To copy metadata both the source and all destination files must be on-line and not write-protected.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_COPYATTR_SOURCEINDEST.con: The source file of the operation is currently selected. You cannot paste attributes to the source file itself.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_COPY_IMAGE.caption: Copy Image
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_COPY_IMAGE.content: This command copies the cache image for the current file as a bitmap into the Windows clipboard.\r\nThe cache representation of the file depends on the settings you have configured for caching.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFILE.caption: Confirm File Deletion
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFILE.content: Do you want to delete the file\n{0}
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFILES.caption: Confirm File Deletion
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFILES.content: Do you really want to delete these {0} files?
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFILE_HS.caption: Confirm Special File Deletion
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFILE_HS.content: <TextBlock>Do you really want to delete the file<LineBreak/>'{0}' ?<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>This file is marked as 'Hidden' and/or 'System'.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFILE_RO.caption: Confirm File Deletion
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFILE_RO.content: <TextBlock>Do you really want to delete the <Bold>read-only</Bold> file<LineBreak/>'{0}' ?</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFOLDER.caption: Confirm Folder Deletion
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFOLDER.content: Do you want to delete the folder\n{0}\nand all files and sub-folders contained in this folder?
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFOLDERS.caption: Confirm Folder Deletion
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETEFOLDERS.content: Do you want to delete {0} folders and all files and sub-folders contained within these folders?
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETE_FOLDER_EXTTFILES.c: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>One or more of the folders you are about to delete contain files which are not included in your database. These files are not visible in IMatch.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>You may want to double-check the folder in Windows Explorer before you delete it.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/><Bold>Example Files:</Bold><LineBreak/><LineBreak/>{0}<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>Do you want to delete the folder anyway?</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETE_REJECTS_ALL.conten: <TextBlock>Do you really want to delete all <Bold>{0} files</Bold> with a <Italic>Reject</Italic> rating?</TextBlock>
Delete only files in the current scope
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_DELETE_REJECTS_SCOPE.cont: <TextBlock>There are <Bold>{0} files</Bold> in the current scope and <Bold>{1} files</Bold> in total with a <Italic>Reject</Italic> rating.<LineBreak/>What do you want to do?</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_COPYFILE.caption: Error while copying a file
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_COPYFILE_BUDDYDUPE.co:
The file 

{0}

could not be copied.
It has one or more buddy files and files with the same names already exist in the target folder.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_COPYFOLDER.caption: Error while copying a folder
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_COPYFOLDER.content: An error occurred while copying the folder\n{0}
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_DELETEFILE.caption: Error while deleting a file
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_DELETEFILE.content:
The file
{0}
could not be deleted.
Make sure that the file is not write-protected, not currently in use and that you have sufficient privileges to delete files.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_DELETEFOLDER.caption: Error while deleting a folder
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_MOVEFILE.caption: Error while moving a file
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_MOVEFOLDER.caption: Error while moving a folder
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_MOVEFOLDER.content: An error occurred while moving the folder\n{0}
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_RENAMEFILE.caption: Error while renaming a file
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_RENAMEFILE.content:
The file
{0}
could not be renamed.
Make sure that the file is not write-protected, not currently in use and that you have sufficient privileges to change files.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_RENAMEFILE_DUPE.conte:
The file

{0}

could not be renamed to

{1}.

A file with this name already exists.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ERR_RENAMEFOLDER.caption: Error while renaming a file
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ORIENTATION.caption: Unsupported or Read-only files
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_ORIENTATION.content: One or more files in the selection are unsupported or read-only.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_REMOVEFILE.caption: Confirm File Removal
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_REMOVEFILE.content: Do you want to remove the selected file(s) and all associated data from the database?\r\nThis process cannot be undone!
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_REMOVEFILE.footer: This process will not remove the physical file from your hard disk or other storage media.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_RENAME_FILE_EXTCHANGE.con: If you change the file name extension the file may become unusable.\r\n\r\nAre you sure you want to change it?
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_REPLACEFILE.caption: File already exists
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_SETEXIFDT_EXIF_WB_WARNING:
One or more files in the selection contains EXIF or IPTC data but IMatch is not allowed to update this data because of your 'Edit > Preferences > Metadata 2' settings.

Re-importing the files will replace the new XMP timestamps with the old EXIF/IPTC timestamps.

Do you want to continue?
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEOP_SETEXIFORIENTATION_WB_WAR: The EXIF data in one or more of the selected files cannot be written because your 'Metadata 2' settings. These files will be skipped.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_CATEGORY_THUMBNAIL.conte: This type of category does not support category thumbnails.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_CUSTOM_SORT_WARNING.cont:
Some files are currently hidden by one or more stacks.
Manually reordering files while some files are hidden may cause unexpected results.

Do you want to show all hidden files now? You can hide them again via the toolbar button or the '[[cID_FILEWND_SHOW_STACKED]]' command in the context menu.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_DLGLAYOUT_INVALIDNAME.co: Each layout must have a unique, non-empty name
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_DLGLAYOUT_RENAME.caption: Rename Layout
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_DLGLAYOUT_RENAME.content: You have entered a new name for the current layout.\nDo you want to apply this change?
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FACEIMPORT.caption: Import XMP Face Data
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FACEIMPORT.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping="Wrap">This command deletes existing Face Annotations in all selected files, and then re-imports existing face regions from XMP metadata.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>Use this command when you want to import face regions manually, or when you have changed any of the options which control how face regions are imported and converted into IMatch Face Annotations.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FACE_DELETE.caption: Delete Face Annotations
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FACE_DELETE.content: Removing face annotations is a privacy feature.\r\nDo you really want to remove the face annotations from all selected files?
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FACE_DETECT_RESULTS.cont: {0} file(s) processed and {1} file(s) updated.\r\n{2} Face Annotations created.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FACE_READ_XMP.caption: Read Face Annotations from XMP Record
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FACE_READ_XMP.content: This command removes all IMatch Face Annotations and re-creates them from face regions found in XMP metadata.\r\n\r\nYou can use this command to manually create Face Annotations when you have disabled the automatic import (Edit > Preferences > Metadata 2) or when you need to update/repair IMatch Face Annotations from XMP face data.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FACE_WRITE_XMP.caption: Write Face Annotations into XMP Record
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FACE_WRITE_XMP.content: This command writes IMatch Face Annotations into the XMP record for all selected image files.\r\n\r\nThis command can be useful when you need to restore XMP face data removed in other applications, or to correct invalid face region data from the current IMatch Face Annotations.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FILEDEL_PROMPT_REJECT.co: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>You have set your preference to <Italic>reject</Italic> files when pressing the <Bold>Del</Bold> key. To remove the reject rating, press <Bold>Del</Bold> again. To delete the file, press <Bold>Ctrl+Del</Bold>.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>You can configure this behavior under <Italic>Edit > Preferences > Application</Italic>.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FILERENAME.caption: Multiple files selected
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_FILERENAME.content: Do you want to run the Renamer to rename all files?\r\nChoose 'No' to rename only the focused file.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_HDROP.caption: File Drop
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_HDROP.content: You have dropped files and/or folders to the file window. Do you want IMatch to copy/move these files/folders into the currently selected folder?
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_HDROP.footer: Hold down the <Ctrl> key to copy files and folders.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_HIST_DELEVENT.caption: Delete Event
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_HIST_DELEVENT.content: Do you really want to delete the selected event?
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_LOD_EDIT_TIP.caption: Full Layout Editor
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_LOD_EDIT_TIP.content: To open the full layout editor directly, hold down the <Ctrl> key when selecting this command.
You should use this command only when you have to work with very old software that does not support the standard EXIF Orientation tag.\r\n\r\nThe lossless rotation will only change the pixel data, but not adjust EXIF or XMP data contained in the file. This may cause problems when you work with IMatch Annotations or XMP face regions. It is recommended to use the EXIF Orientation functions instead.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_MDIMPORT.caption: Some Metadata is protected
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_MDIMPORT.content: You have configured options to protect unwritten metadata and/or rating and label under Edit > Preferences > Metadata. These options are also effective for this metadata import.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_OPEN_STACK_IN_VIEWER.con: Only one file is selected and this file is the top element of a collapsed stack. IMatch opens the entire stack in the Viewer.\r\n\r\nYou can change this behavior in the application settings for the Viewer.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_PROTECTFILES_DISABLED.co: You cannot remove protection from files while file protection is active. Go to the 'View' menu and disable file protection.
The password changes have been reset. The original password is again valid.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_SEARCH_STACK_WARNING.con: Some files are currently hidden by one or more stacks and will not be searched.\r\n\r\nTo search all files, make sure all stacks are expanded.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_STACK_SELECT_EXPAND.cont: Before you can select all files in this stack you need to expand it.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILEWND_STACK_TOGGLE_WARNING.con: You have enabled the option to display files hidden by stacks (toolbar button). Changing the stack state in this mode has no effect on the files displayed in the file window.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILE_READONLY_OVERWRITE.caption: Read-only File
messages.PTR_MSG_FILE_READONLY_OVERWRITE.content: The file {0} is read-only and cannot be overwritten.
messages.PTR_MSG_FILE_REPLACE.caption: Replace File
messages.PTR_MSG_FILE_REPLACE.content: The file {0} already exists.\n\nDo you want to replace it?
messages.PTR_MSG_FILTERPANEL_DELETE.caption: Delete Filter
messages.PTR_MSG_FILTERPANEL_DELETE.content: Do you really want to delete the selected filter?
messages.PTR_MSG_FILTERPANEL_NOORIGINALS.caption: No selected files
messages.PTR_MSG_FILTERPANEL_NOORIGINALS.content: This filter requires a selection (originals) to work with.\r\nPlease select at least one file in the file window.
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_DELETE.caption: Confirm Folder Deletion
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_DELETE.content: <TextBlock>Do you really want to delete the folder<LineBreak/><Bold>{0}</Bold>?</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_DELETE.footer: This operation deletes the folder, all sub-folders and files from the disk.
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_DELETE_MULTI.caption: Confirm Folder Deletion
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_DELETE_MULTI.content: <TextBlock>Do you really want to delete all selected folders from the database and the disk?<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>This operation cannot be undone!</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_DELETE_MULTI.footer: This operation deletes the folder, all sub-folders and files from the disk.
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_FRIENDLYFOLDERNAME_CREATE: You cannot create new folders while displaying friendly folder names.\n\nDo you want to revert to normal folder name display?
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_REMOVE.caption: Confirm Folder Removal
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_REMOVE.content: <TextBlock>Do you really want to remove the folder<LineBreak/><LineBreak/><Bold>{0}</Bold><LineBreak/><LineBreak/>and all associated information from the database?<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>This operation cannot be undone!</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_REMOVE.footer: Removing a folder from the database will not delete the physical folder or its contents on the disk.
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_REMOVE_MULTI.caption: Confirm Folder Removal
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_REMOVE_MULTI.content: <TextBlock>Do you really want to remove all selected folders and all associated information from the database?<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>This operation cannot be undone!</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_REMOVE_MULTI.footer: Removing a folder from the database will not delete the physical folder or its contents on the disk.
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_REMOVE_SUBFOLDERS.caption: Retain Sub-folders
messages.PTR_MSG_FOLDER_REMOVE_SUBFOLDERS.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>Do you want to keep the sub-folders in the database?<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>If you confirm, only the selected folder(s) will be removed. Sub-folders will be retained and linked directly to the drive/media node.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>Use this if you have accidentally added a root folder or another high-level folder to your database an you want now to revert this.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_FORCE_EMPTY_TASKMANAGER.caption: Closing Database
messages.PTR_MSG_FORCE_EMPTY_TASKMANAGER.content:
Running a database diagnosis will automatically close and re-open the database.
This will also clear tempoary information, e.g. the information required for Undo.

Do you want to run the diagnosis now?
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_FILE_SAVEPROMPT.caption: Exit without saving
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_FILE_SAVEPROMPT.content: The changes made have not yet been saved to the database.\r\n\r\nDo you really want to quit without saving?
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_FILE_SKIPPED.caption: Files without GPS data found
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_FILE_SKIPPED.content: One or more files in the current selection have no valid GPS coordinates.\r\n\r\nThese files have been ignored.
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_FILE_WRITEBACKINFO.caption: Metadata Mapping
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_FILE_WRITEBACKINFO.content: IMatch saves the location information to a set of standard metadata tags. Depending on your metadata settings, this information will be distributed to other metadata tags when IMatch is saving the metadata in the file.\r\n\r\nTo see the final result, you have to write-back the file(s).
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_GEONAMES_API_KEY.caption: GeoNames.org Reverse Geocoding
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_GEONAMES_API_KEY.content: To use the reverse geocoding provided by GeoNames.org you have to enter a valid GeoNames.org username in Edit > Preferences > Geo & Maps.\r\n\r\nSee the IMatch help (<F1> key) for details.
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_GOOGLE_API_KEY.caption: Google Reverse Geocoding
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_GOOGLE_API_KEY.content: To use the reverse geocoding provided by Google you have to enter a valid Google Maps API key in Edit > Preferences > Geo & Maps. This key must be enabled for the Maps, Reverse Geocoding and Elevation APIs.\r\n\r\nSee the IMatch help for details.
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_LOCATION_DELETE.caption: Delete Location
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_LOCATION_DELETE.content: Do you want to delete the selected location?
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_LOCATION_NOTARGET.caption: No Target Marker found
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_LOCATION_NOTARGET.content: Please left-click the map to position the target marker, or load a location.
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_MANYFILESWARNING.caption: Too many files
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_MANYFILESWARNING.content: You have configured the Geo Panel to show a maximum of {0} files.
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_MANYFILESWARNING.footer: You can configure the threshold under Edit > Preferences > Geo && Maps
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_PROMPTUPDATE.caption: Updating GPS data
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_PROMPTUPDATE.content: This will update the GPS coordinates of all selected files.\r\nDo you want to continue?
messages.PTR_MSG_GEO_SERVERDOWN.caption: Connection Problem
messages.PTR_MSG_HELPAPP_MISSING.btn.1001: Switch to the online help version
messages.PTR_MSG_HELPAPP_MISSING.btn.1002: Download the IMatch Help System App
messages.PTR_MSG_HELPAPP_MISSING.caption: IMatch Help System not installed
messages.PTR_MSG_HELPAPP_MISSING.content: You have configured IMatch to use the installed help system instead of the online version. The IMatch help has not been installed yet or cannot be found.
messages.PTR_MSG_HELPAPP_OUTDATED.caption: IMatch Help Outdated
messages.PTR_MSG_HELPAPP_OUTDATED.content: The version of the IMatch Help System installed on your computer is outdated.
messages.PTR_MSG_HELP_CHOICE.btn.1002: Download the current version of the help app
messages.PTR_MSG_HELP_CHOICE.caption: The IMatch Help System
messages.PTR_MSG_HELP_CHOICE.content: IMatch by default uses the web-based help system at www.photools.com. This ensures that you always have access to the most up-to-date version of the help and that you can easily translate help contents into your language using the built-in translation features in your web browser.\r\n\r\nIf you prefer a locally installed help or your computer is not always connected to the Internet, you can download a self-contained version of the help system for installation.
messages.PTR_MSG_HELP_CHOICE.footer: You can change this setting any time under Edit > Preferences > Application.
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_BATCH_EXPORT_CLEANFOLDERW: You have enabled the option to clean the output folder. All existing files and sub-folders will be deleted before the conversion begins.
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_BATCH_EXPORT_OVERWRITEPRO: <TextBlock>Do you want to replace the existing file<Bold>{0}</Bold>?</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_BATCH_EXPORT_PENDINGMDWRI: One or more of the source files have pending metadata updates and you have disabled background metadata updates.\r\n\r\nIMatch can only copy metadata to the output file that's contained in the source file. Do you want to write the pending metadata now to the source file so it can be copied to the output file as well?
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_BATCH_EXPORT_UNITRESCHANG: Changing the units or resolution affects other measures used by the Batch processor, e.g the output size, margins, positions of text and image overlays.\r\nDo you want IMatch to correct these measures automatcially based on the new units?
There may be some rounding errors when converting between different units. You should check all settings afterward.
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_EMAIL_ACCOUNTINFO.caption: Email Accounts
