messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_EMAIL_ACCOUNTINFO.content: You have currently no email accounts configured. You can configure your mail server etc. by clicking on the [...] button next to the Account list.
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_EMAIL_FAIL.caption: Problem sending email
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_EMAIL_FAIL.content: IMatch could not send the email. Please check the account information.
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_EMAIL_SUCCESS.caption: Success
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_EMAIL_SUCCESS.content: The email has been successfully sent.
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_EMAIL_TESTOK.caption: Success
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_EMAIL_TESTOK.content: The email has been successfully sent. Please check your inbox.
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_FILE_CREATEWRITEFAILED.ca: File cannot be created or written
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_FILE_CREATEWRITEFAILED.co: <TextBlock>The file <Bold>{0}</Bold> could not be created or written.<LineBreak/>Please ensure that you have write permissions to the folder and file and that the file is not open in another application.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_FILE_DOES_NOT_EXIST.conte: <TextBlock>The file <Bold>{0}</Bold> does not exist or is currently locked by another application.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_GROUP_IMPORT_WARNINGS.con: One or more folders or files could not be found in the target database.\nSee the IMatch log file for details about which folders and files have been skipped.
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_NO_BATCH_PRESETS.caption: No Batch Processor Presets found
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_NO_BATCH_PRESETS.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>You can apply <Bold>Batch Processor Presets</Bold> to the files you send by email, e.g. to resize images, change the file format or to add watermarks.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>Run the Batch Processor once in order to create a set of default presets and to setup your own presets. These presets will then be available in this dialog.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_PROMPTPRESETSAVE.caption: Save Changes
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_PROMPTPRESETSAVE.content: <TextBlock>Do you want to save changes made to the preset <Bold>{0}</Bold>?</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_TEXT_EXPORT_COMPLETED.con: <TextBlock>The output file has been written to <Bold>{0}</Bold>.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_TEXT_EXPORT_WARNINGS.cont: The field expression contains invalid names and/or expressions.
messages.PTR_MSG_IMPEXP_UNKNOWN_FILE_FORMAT.conte: <TextBlock>The file <Bold>{0}</Bold> format cannot be read or the file is damaged.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_IMWS_START_FAILED.caption: Embedded WebServer failed to start
messages.PTR_MSG_IMWS_START_FAILED.content:
The embedded web server in IMatch (IMWS) failed to start. App-based features are not available.

This problem is most likely caused by the configured port number (Edit > Preferences > Application) which is already used by another software or service running on your computer. Try to change the port number (use something in the range between 49152 - 65535) and then restart IMatch.

Tip: You can use the netstat -b command from a command prompt window to see a list of all ports in use on your system.
messages.PTR_MSG_IMWS_START_FAILED.info: The log file IMATCH_IMWS_ERRORLOG.TXT in the TEMP folder on your system contains additional information. Please include this file when you contact support.
messages.PTR_MSG_LOGFILE_DEBUG_LOGGING.caption: Debug Logging enabled
messages.PTR_MSG_LOGFILE_DEBUG_LOGGING.content:
IMatch is configured to use extensive debug-level logging.

If you are not currently diagnosing a problem, you should reset the log file back to normal logging. This saves disk space and makes IMatch run a bit faster.

To change the log file settings, open the Help menu and then open 'Support'.
messages.PTR_MSG_LOGFILE_HAD_ERROR.caption: Errors reported
messages.PTR_MSG_LOGFILE_HAD_ERROR.content:
One or more errors where written to the application logfile. Such errors can have a variety of reasons, from temporary low-memory conditions to problems while creating or writing to a file.

You may want to review the log file to see addtional details about these errors. Just search the log file for lines containing E> to find all relevant entries.

If you experienced a problem while working with IMatch and you file a bug report in the community, please attach the zipped log file to your report.
messages.PTR_MSG_LOLEROT_ERRORS.caption: One or more files failed
messages.PTR_MSG_LOLEROT_ERRORS.content: There were errors rotating one or more files. Please see the IMatch log file for details.
messages.PTR_MSG_LOLEROT_NOSUITABLEFILES.caption: Inappropriate file(s) in selection
messages.PTR_MSG_LOLEROT_NOSUITABLEFILES.content: This feature only works for JPEG files. There is a at least one non-JPEG files in the current selection, or one or more of the files JPEG are read-only or off-line.
messages.PTR_MSG_LRU_CLEAR.caption: Confirmation
messages.PTR_MSG_LRU_CLEAR.content: Are you sure you want to clear the list with last recently used entries?
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_TAGMGR_DIFF.caption: Changes
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_TAGMGR_DIFF.content:
<StackPanel>
						<TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap' Margin='0,0,0,10'>You have made the following changes:</TextBlock>
						<TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>{1} groups included, {2} groups excluded, {3} groups changed.</TextBlock>
						<TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>{4} tags included, {5} tags excluded, {6} tags changed.</TextBlock>
						<TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap' Margin='0,20,0,0'>If you excluded groups or tags, the data associated with these groups and tags remains in the database until you run the next <Bold>Database Diagnosis</Bold>.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>If you have included new groups or tags, you need to <Bold>rescan</Bold> the files (or re-load metadata) to import the data for these tags into the database.</TextBlock>
						</StackPanel>
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_UPDATEPENDING.caption: Cannot Modify Files
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_UPDATEPENDING.content: One or more of the files in the selection are currently being updated or imported. Please wait for this process to finish before you attempt to make changes.
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_BEGIN.caption: Write-back Metadata
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_BEGIN.content: There are {0} files with pending metadata.\nDo you want to write back to these files now?
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_NOTHINGTODO.caption: Write-back Metadata
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_NOTHINGTODO.content: There are no files with pending metadata.\nNothing to do.
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_NOTNOW.caption: Database is busy
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_NOTNOW.content: IMatch is currently processing other data (e.g. importing files).\r\n\r\nYou cannot write-back files at this time. Please retry in a minute. Check the Info & Activity Panel for background processing.
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_RESULTS.caption: Write-back Metadata
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_RESULTS.content: {0} file(s) have been updated.\nThere were {1} error(s) and {2} file(s) were off-line or read-only.
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_RESULTS.info: See the Output panel (ExifTool tab) and the IMatch log file for additional information about errors and warnings.
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_RO_ALL.caption: Read-only Files
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_RO_ALL.content: All files in the selection are marked as read-only on disk or are on a non-writable media.
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_RO_ONEORMORE.conten: One file in the selection is marked as read-only on disk or on a non-writable media.
{0} files in the selection are marked as read-only on disk or are on a non-writable media.
messages.PTR_MSG_MB_WRITEBACK_TOOMANYFILES.conten: Attempting to write-back this many files in one operation would cause too much stress on the system. Please select no more than 10,000 files for a single write-back operation.
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_KWPROPAGATE.caption: Propagate Keywords?
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_KWPROPAGATE.content: This operation propagates hierarchical keywords into normal (flat) keywords for all selected files.\r\n\r\nUse this after you have made changes to the thesaurus or metadata options which affect how hierarchical keywords are propagated.
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_KW_TOOMANYFILESFORME: You have selected a large number of files. The Keyword Panel shows only the keywords of the focused file and does not attempt merge the keywords of all selected files.\n\nThe changes you make will still be written to all selected files.
&Merge\nMerge the new layouts with the existing layouts.
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_PANELDELETE.caption: Delete Custom Panel
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_PANELDELETE.content: Do you really want to delete the panel '{0}'?
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_PASTE_KEYWORDS.btn.1: &Merge\nAdd the new keywords to the existing keywords.
&Replace\nReplace existing keywords with the new keywords.
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_PASTE_KEYWORDSCOMMAC: The text in the clipboard contains commas. IMatch uses semicolons to separate multiple keywords.\r\n\r\nDo you want to automatically replace ',' with ';' ?
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_SAVEBTN.caption: Changes are saved to the database.
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_SAVEBTN.content: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'>Automatic write-back is disabled.\r\nTo write the metadata changes you have just made to the actual file use the corresponding commands from the <Bold>Commands</Bold> menu or click on the <Bold>Pen</Bold> icon in the file window panel.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_SAVEBTN.footer: <TextBlock>Go to <Italic>Edit > Preferences > Background Processing</Italic> to configure when IMatch writes metadata to files.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_SAVEPROMPT.caption: Save Changes?
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_SAVEPROMPT.content: Do you want to save the changes you have made to the metadata?
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_THES_ADD_ELEM_NOPATH: Please choose where to add the new element:
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_THES_DEL_ELEM.conten: Do you really want to delete the selected element?
An element with this name already exists in the thesaurus.
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_THES_INVALID_NAME.co: The element name contains one or more invalid characters.
messages.PTR_MSG_MDCONTAINER_TOOMANYFILESFORMERGE: You have selected a large number of files. The Metadata Panel shows only the metadata of the focused file and does not attempt merge the metadata of all selected files.\n\nThe changes you make will still be written to all selected files.
messages.PTR_MSG_MDTEMPLATE_DUPLICATENAME.caption: Name already in use
messages.PTR_MSG_MDTEMPLATE_DUPLICATENAME.content: Do you want to replace the existing template?
messages.PTR_MSG_NEEDMIGRATION.caption: Database Upgrade Required.
messages.PTR_MSG_NEEDMIGRATION.content:
This database was created by an older IMatch version and needs to be updated in order to work with the current version.

After this upgrade, the database cannot be used with older IMatch or IMatch Anywhere versions anymore. You may want to create a backup of your database first.

Do you want to open and upgrade the database now?
messages.PTR_MSG_NEEDMIGRATION.footer: If you have just installed a new version of IMatch, this message is normal.
messages.PTR_MSG_NEW_VERSION.caption: A new version of IMatch has just been installed.
messages.PTR_MSG_NEW_VERSION.content: Now would be a great time to open the release notes to see what has changed and which features have been added.\r\n\r\nDo you want to open the release notes page now?
messages.PTR_MSG_NEW_VERSION.footer: You can open the release notes anytime from the Help menu.
messages.PTR_MSG_NOTIMPLEMENTED.caption: <TextBlock FontSize="20" FontWeight="Bold"><Bold>Oops!</Bold></TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_NOTIMPLEMENTED.content: This feature has not yet been implemented.
messages.PTR_MSG_NO_SPELL_DICT.btn.1003: I don't want to use spell checking in IMatch
messages.PTR_MSG_NO_SPELL_DICT.caption: Spell checker
messages.PTR_MSG_NO_SPELL_DICT.content: You have not yet installed a dictionary for the IMatch spell checker. Spell checking is not available until you download and install a dictionary for your language.
messages.PTR_MSG_OPENDB_PASSWORD.caption: Database Password
messages.PTR_MSG_OPENDB_PASSWORD.content: <TextBlock><Bold>This database is protected by a password.</Bold><LineBreak/>Only users who know the password can open this database.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>Please enter the database password</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_ADD_PAGE_TIP.caption: New Page
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_ADD_PAGE_TIP.content: Tip: You can convert the containers into other container types using the 'Convert' command from the context menu.
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_CONTAINER_CLONECLICK.con: This container is a clone and cannot be modified. Please modify the source container.
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_CONTAINER_PASTE_CELL.btn: Original grid cell\nInsert the new containers into the same grid cell as the orignal container.
Re-position to selected grid cell\nInsert the containers relative to the selected cell {c},{r}.
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_CONTAINER_PASTE_CELL.con: You are pasting one or more containers which are positioned relative to a grid cell. What do you want to do?
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_CONTAINER_ZORDER_INTERAC:
The order in which containers are drawn (Z-Order) controls how containers overlap and also which container is used as the data source for Text and QR-Code containers.

Click into containers to set the order in which they are drawn, from level 1 to n.

Click somewhere outside a container or press <ESC> to finish. The process will finish automatically when you have clicked each container once.
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_DROP_CONVERT_G2F.btn.100: Convert to File container\nConverts the container into a File container and links the file to it.
Just use the file name\nKeep the Graphics container but update it to use the name of the dropped file.
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_DROP_CONVERT_G2F.caption: Convert Container
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_DROP_CONVERT_G2F.content: You have dropped a file from the database to a Graphics container. What do you want to do?
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_DROP_HDROP.btn.1001: Content\nUse the dropped image as the content image
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_DROP_HDROP.btn.1002: Fill\nUse the dropped image as the Fill image
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_DROP_HDROP.btn.1003: Overlay\nUse the dropped image as the Overlay
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_DROP_HDROP.btn.1004: Mask\nUse the dropped image as the Mask

messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_DROP_HDROP.content: What do you want to do?

Overlay\nUse the dropped image as the Overlay
Mask\nUse the dropped image as the Mask

messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_NO_ICC_PROFILE.caption: No Color Profile
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_NO_ICC_PROFILE.content: You need to select a color profile before you can enable soft-proofing.

messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_QUEUE_JOBSRUNNING.conten: There are one or more print jobs still in the queue. If you close IMatch now, these print jobs will be canceled.\r\n\r\nDo you want to close IMatch now?
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_RES_TO_HIGH.caption: Resolution too high
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_RES_TO_HIGH.content: You have chosen a very high output resolution. Some parts of the document may not render correctly.\r\n\r\nReduce the output resolution to be 600 DPI or less.
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_SAVE_BEFORE_PRINT.conten: You need to save the document template before you can print it.
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_TEMPLATE_DELETE.caption: Delete Document Template
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_TEMPLATE_DELETE.content: <TextBlock>Do you really want to delete the template<LineBreak/><Bold>{0}</Bold>?<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>This operation cannot be undone.</TextBlock>
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_TEMPLATE_LOAD_RELOC.cont: This template was created using a different database. IMatch has automatically updated {0} file references to link to the current database.\r\n\r\n{1} file(s) could not be relocated because they are not included in the current database. You have to update the associated file containers manually.

messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_TEMPLATE_MISSING.content:
The template

'{0}'

does not exist or is inaccessible.
The current template has unsaved changes. What do you want to do?
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_TEMPLATE_MODIFIED_ON_DIS: The document template was modified by an external application.\nDo you want to reload it?
messages.PTR_MSG_PRINTUI_TEMPLATE_SAVE_AS.btn.100: Only for me\nStore the template in my personal template folder.
For all users\nStore the template in the shared template folder.\nAll IMatch users can see and use the template.

messages.PTR_MSG_RESCAN_OPTIONS.btn.1: Normal Rescan\nThis option performs a normal rescan using the standard options.
messages.PTR_MSG_RESCAN_OPTIONS.btn.1001: Force Update\nUnconditionally rescan all files. This option may be helpful if you have processed files in other applications and these applications do not update the last modified timestamp on disk.
messages.PTR_MSG_RESCAN_OPTIONS.btn.1002: Reload Metadata\nLoad the meta data contained in the files into the database, replacing the database contents.
messages.PTR_MSG_RESCAN_OPTIONS.btn.1003: Update Cache only\nRe-create the cache images using the current cache settings. Hold down <Ctrl> when choosing this option to force cache file generation (ignore on-demand settings).

messages.PTR_MSG_RESMGR_RELOAD.caption: Reloading Resources

This will reload changes made to the resource file.
Please note that not all changes can be applied without restarting IMatch. See the translator documentation for details.

Do you want to continue?
messages.PTR_MSG_RESMGR_RELOAD.footer: Errors in the resource file will cause IMatch to close!

'{0}'

The database needs to be updated because a new version of ExifTool was detected, or there were some updates to a configuration file.

Since the database has been opened in read-only mode, the required updates cannot be performed.

Please close the database now and open it in writable mode. IMatch then performs the required updates automatically.
messages.PTR_MSG_SCRIPTS_APPSCRIPTPROMPT.caption: Application script not found!

Please note that changes made to system scripts will be overwritten when you install the next IMatch update.\n\nIf you want to create your own script based on a system script, copy the system script and all depending files into the 'User' script folder.

messages.PTR_MSG_SHARING.info: To share a database between multiple users, the database must be opened in read-only mode by all users.
messages.PTR_MSG_SHUTDOWNFAILURE.btn.1: Continue\nStart IMatch normally and with the last loaded database.
messages.PTR_MSG_SHUTDOWNFAILURE.btn.1001: Start without Database\nUse this option if there was a problem loading the database.
messages.PTR_MSG_SHUTDOWNFAILURE.btn.1002: View Log File\nThe IMatch log file from the last session may contain valuable information about the problem.
messages.PTR_MSG_SHUTDOWNFAILURE.btn.1003: Copy Log File Name\nThis option copies the full file name of the log file to the Windows clipboard.
messages.PTR_MSG_SHUTDOWNFAILURE.caption: Information
messages.PTR_MSG_SHUTDOWNFAILURE.content:
IMatch did not shut down properly the last time it was run.
This may have been caused by a program error or another external cause.

A log file of this session has been created under

{0}

This file may be helpful to gather more information about the cause of the problem.
messages.PTR_MSG_SHUTDOWNFAILURE.footer: You may want to include this log file if you contact support regarding this issue.

Import the categories into the thesaurus and also assign the resulting keywords to all files referenced in the import file.

Tip: If you want to set 'Group Level' or 'Exclude' options for one or more of the imported categories, run the import twice. First import the categories and change the properties afterwards as needed. Then import the file again, this time let IMatch assign the keywords.

You are managing image files in your database for which IMatch requires a WIC codec to be installed. Without the codec, IMatch may be unable to create thumbnails or cache images.

Please download the WIC codec for your camera model from the camera vendor web site and install it. More information is available in the help.

dialogs.PTRMDLG_MBTHESMGR_IMPORT_IMIPTCUSR.#l_ch: Auto-group elements by their first characters:

If you have thousands of elements to import, you can let IMatch group them automatically by their first character (or first n characters). This brings some order in the thesaurus and speeds up processing and display.
dialogs.PTRMDLG_MBTHESMGR_IMPORT_IMIPTCUSR.#l_pa: Make elements containing the text below the parent elements of imported elements.

If you uses special text elements to make group or parent elements 'stand out' in the IMatch 3 thesaurus, this option allows you to find these elements and to make them parent elements for all elements following. The next element with the given pattern will again be made a parent element.
Mark these elements as group level
If this option is enabled, elements considered as parents are marked as group-levels in the thesaurus.

dialogs.PTRMDLG_NEWDB.#l_header: <Bold>Creating a Database</Bold><LineBreak/>To manage your images and other files, IMatch uses a database file stored on your hard disk.<LineBreak/><Bold>Tip:</Bold> Use your fastest hard disk and create a separate folder to hold the database file.
dialogs.PTRMDLG_NEWDB.#l_pw1:H: Enter a password consisting of letters and digits.
dialogs.PTRMDLG_NEWDB.#l_pw2:H: Enter a password consisting of letters and digits.
dialogs.PTRMDLG_NEWDB.#l_pwinfo: <Bold>Password Security</Bold><LineBreak/>You can optionally protect the database via a password of your choice. Only users who know the password can open the database. If you don't want to assign a password now just leave the password fields blank.
dialogs.PTRMDLG_NEWDB.#l_showme:H: Show me\nClick here to see a preview and the disk space requirements of the chosen thumbnail size.
dialogs.PTRMDLG_NEWDB.#l_thumbinfo: <Bold>Initial Thumbnail Settings</Bold><LineBreak/>The settings below control the size of the thumbnails IMatch stores in the database. Smaller thumbnails require less disk space and are faster to load and display.<LineBreak/>The default size is usually a good choice, and you can change the size later at any time.
dialogs.PTRMDLG_NEWDB.#l_thumbsize:H: Thumbnail Size\nThe size of the thumbnails in pixel.
dialogs.PTRMDLG_NEWDB.caption: Create Database
dialogs.PTRMDLG_NEWDB_POSTCREATE.#l_buddy_files: <Bold>Buddy Files</Bold><LineBreak/>If you use RAW file formats, you often have secondary files ('buddy' files) which go with each file. These files may be created by the camera or another software. Please select the RAW formats you use in the list and enter all buddy file extensions the input field:
dialogs.PTRMDLG_NEWDB_POSTCREATE.#l_cache_option: <Bold>Cache Options</Bold><LineBreak/>IMatch uses a cache to display files of any size quickly. Please select at which time IMatch creates cache files:
dialogs.PTRMDLG_NEWDB_POSTCREATE.#l_drop: You can <Bold>drag some of your RAW files into this dialog</Bold> to add them to the list.<LineBreak/><LineBreak/>To change these settings later, go to <Bold>Edit > Preferences > File Relations</Bold>.

dialogs.PTRMDLG_PRINTUI_NEW_TEMPLATE.#l_info_dyn: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'><Bold>Dynamic Template</Bold><LineBreak/>A dynamic template is ideal for re-occurring print jobs where you want to process a <Italic>variable number of files automatically</Italic>. For example: <Bold>contact sheets, catalogs or reports</Bold>. Using the info in the template, IMatch automatically creates covers, headers and normal pages as needed.</TextBlock>
dialogs.PTRMDLG_PRINTUI_NEW_TEMPLATE.#l_info_sta: <TextBlock TextWrapping='Wrap'><Bold>Standard Template</Bold><LineBreak/>A standard template is used for print documents like <Bold>photo books, calendars or leaflets</Bold>. You add as many pages as you need, manually arranging images and other objects on these pages.</TextBlock>

dialogs.PTRMDLG_RELOCATE_DRIVEMEDIA.#l_header: <Bold>Relocating Drives and Media</Bold><LineBreak/>If you moved the contents of a disk or media to another disk or media (e.g. by replacing a disk, connecting a disk differently, moving your images to another computer etc.) the database will report them as off-line. This dialog allows you to tell IMatch where the folders have moved. IMatch updates the database and brings the folders back on-line.
dialogs.PTRMDLG_RELOCATE_DRIVEMEDIA.#l_relocate_: Select the &drive or network resource to relocate to:
dialogs.PTRMDLG_RELOCATE_DRIVEMEDIA.#l_tip: <Bold>Tip</Bold><LineBreak/>If you replace a hard disk, the drive letter is the same as before yet IMatch will report it as off-line. The new drive has a different serial number and that information is used by IMatch to identify the disk. Just relocate <Italic>to the same drive</Italic> letter to update the database with the new media serial number.
dialogs.PTRMDLG_RELOCATE_DRIVEMEDIA.caption: Relocate Drive or Media
dialogs.PTRMDLG_RELOCATE_DRIVEMEDIA_ERROR.#l_fol: &Folders which do not exist on the target drive:
dialogs.PTRMDLG_RELOCATE_DRIVEMEDIA_ERROR.#l_hea: <Bold>Relocating Drives and Media</Bold><LineBreak/>One or more of the folders you want to relocate do not exist on the target drive. Please ensure that all folders you want to relocate exist on the new drive and are accessible.<LineBreak/>IMatch can relocate at least some of the folders. To do so, press the <Bold>Continue</Bold> button below.

<Bold>Relocating Drives and Media</Bold><LineBreak/>The target drive seems to contain <Underline>none</Underline> of the folders you want to relocate. Please ensure that you have chosen the right drive, and that it contains the folders you want to relocate.
dialogs.PTRMDLG_RELOCATE_FOLDER.#l_header: <Bold>Relocating Folders</Bold><LineBreak/>This command allows you to tell IMatch that a folder indexed by the database has been renamed or moved to another folder, drive, media or computer.
